Strengths.Peacekeeping: You not only work to promote harmony and morale while deflecting potential conflicts, you are also deft in persuading and motivating others to get moving in the same direction. You see positive relationships as the sure path to fulfilment and are highly cooperative, promoting cohesion and even friendship within the workplace and beyond.
Strengths.Communication: One of the many keys to your success is the ability to communicate proficiently across diverse media. You have a talent for making words out of ideas whether it is in the classroom or in a love letter. You love writing, talking and telling stories, and your audiences are often equally as enthusiastic to receive what they have to say. As comfortable in large crowds as small groups, you like to be the centre of attention and thrive on the energy of good conversation, especially with people who are as passionate as you are.
Strengths.Persuasiveness: You are known for your powers of persuasion and are generally effective in getting people to do what they want them to do. But you are charitable; the motive is not often manipulation or personal gain, you simply want people to do more or better because it will benefit them or help them realize some potential. These personalities are likeable and trustworthy and, as a result, others are generally compelled to listen to and follow them.
Strengths.Leadership: You have a solid social circle and are likely to be the ones planning events and finding opportunities to get people together. Your leadership skills ensure that others quickly jump on board and are excited about it. Teaching and mentoring come as easily to them as breathing and talking, making you particularly skilled in endeavors that allow you to lead, train or educate. Your idealism helps you to very clearly and accurately see the potential in other people and entities, and your Judging element helps you to map out the path to get there.

Weaknesses.Leap before looking: Passionate and headstrong, you tend to dive in headfirst without fully examining or investigating the endeavour in front of them, or fully considering what it will entail. Your Intuitive nature gets the best of them and they are quite sure they have it all figured out; you may not concern yourself with the necessary and important details.
Weaknesses.Overcommitment: Though they thrive on being a little overwhelmed, you can easily become over-committed because you are genuinely excited about life and all of the opportunities they see before you—you want to say “yes” as much as you can and you want to do it all. As a result, you may later have to pull out of commitments you might have examined more carefully before jumping in, and often end up starting and stopping many things without finishing.
When making decisions, you can struggle with information that seems to lack a human element. Hard logic, impersonal reasoning and data-based conclusions can be difficult and even undesirable. While you may be viewed as compassionate, you may also be seen as unfair since they are likely to prioritize the needs of the individual above the whole and to look more readily to the exceptions than the rules.
Weaknesses.Too selfless: Because you prioritize people and the needs of others, you may not be properly in touch with your own needs and can struggle, at times, to express them if you fear that doing so may create conflict or disunity. If you have not developed a strong sense of self you may fail to be authentic in your relationships. As you already tend toward loneliness, the sense that no one truly knows you can foment the sense of being alone and misunderstood.

Personality Description.Name: The Educator
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You're driven to bring about positivity in the lives around you without being selfish.
Personality Description.Description:
You are an idealist organizer, driven to implement their vision of what is best for humanity. You often act as catalysts for human growth because of your ability to see potential in other people and your charisma in persuading others to your ideas. You are focused on values and vision, and are passionate about the possibilities for people.
You are typically energetic and driven, and often have a lot on their plates. You are tuned into the needs of others and acutely aware of human suffering; however, you also tend to be optimistic and forward-thinking, intuitively seeing opportunity for improvement. You are ambitious, but your ambition is not self-serving: rather, you feel personally responsible for making the world a better place.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You are sociable and outgoing.
2. You draw your energy from the outside world.
3. You talk about your thoughts and feelings and have great communication skills.
4. You are adaptable to every situation and are innovative when problems arise.
5. You are good at multitasking and prefer to work in a team rather than individually.
6. You look for inspiration and ideas from outside sources.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are imaginative and think out of the box.
2. You are innovative, hypothetical and have a futuristic approach towards life.
3. You are highly observant and a deep thinker.
4. You are aware of yourself and your surroundings.
5. You prefer to read between the lines and recognise the connection between random facts
6. Ideas inspire you and you are more likely to focus on the theory than the practice of a project.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You decide with heart and dislike conflict.
2. You are passionate and driven by emotion.
3. You are empathetic and like taking care of others.
4. You pay attention to your moral compass to determine right from wrong and are less interested in the cold, hard facts.
5. You consider the effect of your actions on other people
6. you are concerned with values and what is best for the people involved.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You prefer being organised and live a planned or orderly way of life.
2. You like to be involved in tasks where there is a standard procedure and do not like ambiguity
3. You like to take charge of things and take responsibilities and leading roles.
4. You are self-disciplined and decisive.
5. You don't procrastinate and complete your work on time.

ENFJ.Communication Style: You are a warm, compassionate communicator who shows enthusiasm for other people and their ideas. You want to understand what is important to others so that you can take action to improve the situation for all involved. You readily give affirmation and support, making sure that people know that their ideas are valued. You are good at connecting with a variety of people and creative in coming up with solutions that accommodate others’ needs. You are often a natural teacher and mentor, showing others the way and helping them to improve themselves.
ENFJ.Values and Motivations:
You are driven by a deep sense of altruism and empathy for other people. You have an intuitive sense of the emotions of others, and often act as an emotional barometer for the people around you. However, your compassion is not reserved for the people close to you: you are often humanitarian in nature, and may feel genuine concern for the ills of the entire human race. You tend to personally experience the feelings of others, and feel compelled to act when they see people suffering.
You want close, supportive connections with others, and believe that cooperation is the best way to get things done. You like to be liked and are very sensitive to feedback, both positive and negative. You expect the best not just from yourself, but from others as well, and may find yourself disappointed when others are not as genuine in their intentions as you. You work hard to maintain strong relationships, and strive to be valuable members of your families, groups, and communities.
ENFJ.Work Place Habits:
At work, you are motivated to organize others to implement positive change. You are an enthusiastic problem-solver, especially when you can put your strong intuition about people to good use.
You strive for cooperation and work best in a harmonious environment where You can support other people and encourage their growth. You often take on a mentor role, seeing your primary aim as helping other people become better at what they do.
You are often attracted to leadership roles; you naturally organize people to take advantage of their unique talents. You often have a strong vision in your work, and enjoy being able to use your creativity to develop innovative initiatives with a humanitarian focus. You appreciate teamwork and you want to have the organizational resources to put your ideas into action.
The ideal work environment for you is forward-thinking and people-centered, with a clear humanitarian mission and an emphasis on constructive action. The ideal job for you allows them to develop and implement ideas that improve the circumstances and well-being of other people.
ENFJ.How Others Perceive You:
You are a natural teacher, often found organizing people to take part in some educational activity. You tend to take charge of a situation and guide a group towards those activities and experiences which will help them learn and grow. You intuitively see the potential in people, and with charisma and warmth, you encourage others to pursue greater development of their strengths. You are typically dynamic and productive and are often visibly energized when leading others to discover new knowledge.
You are typically good communicators, talented at using words to connect with others. You are perceptive about people and enjoy talking about relationships. You often enjoy helping others solve personal problems and like to share your insights about people, your emotions, and your motivations. You are empathetic sometimes to the point of being overinvolved and can become exhausted if you are surrounded by too much negative emotion

Growth Potential.Focus on the details: Though you read best between the lines, there are times when the nit-picky details really do matter and, in the end, the boring, impersonal contracts just need to be read. This will be a forced response, but a necessary one. In committing to various projects, endeavors or events, you will benefit from a simple “let me think about it” and then actually taking the time to consider the details, objectives and time commitment before responding.
Growth Potential.Stick to it: You love starting projects and new endeavors, but sometimes bite off more than they can chew. Rather than looking at the project as a whole and becoming overwhelmed, breaking the work into small pieces and viewing each chunk as a distinct goal can help you maintain enthusiasm and drive.
Growth Potential.Get comfortable with conflict: Disunity, divisiveness and conflict are not the end of the world and not something always to be avoided. You do crave amicable rather than adversarial relationships, but growth often happens in the space of tension. When you allow yourself to intentionally confront and deal with conflict, good things—even deepened relationships—may result.
Growth Potential.Live in the now: You are, by nature, future-oriented and while this helps you to visualize potential, it can keep you from dealing with life in the here and now—the possibilities are so much more exciting than the present reality! While you will continue to look to the best the future has to offer, you need to put their scheduling and planning skills into practice to get going on the tasks of today so that you may achieve their future goals.
Growth Potential.Mind their bottom line: While you do derive personal satisfaction from being helpful to others, they must be serious about their own talents and the income that should come as a result. It is possible to help people, make a contribution to the world and make a living wage. You may also need to work on becoming more task-oriented and concerned with productivity. It is easy to get caught up in the relational aspects of a project or job and fail to meet the objectives and expectations. You will have to work to keep interpersonal relations and productivity in balance.

Strengths.Excellent communicators: You have outstanding communication skills and you know how to use them. You will engage anyone in conversation at the drop of a hat, and you know how to draw others out in a way that keeps the discussion flowing. Whether casually shooting the breeze or collaborating in the workplace, you provide the horsepower that keeps the engine of conversation humming along.
Strengths.Imaginative: You are an imaginative problem solver and reject the idea that traditional ways are always the best. In every situation, you believe an original approach is possible—and desirable—and you refuse to become prisoners of habit or routine. You see roadblocks as opportunities, and you confront every challenge you face with fresh eyes and no preconceived notions.
Strengths.Natural leaders: You step forward to assume positions of leadership readily and instinctively. You are confident in their ability to handle demanding responsibilities many people find scary or intimidating. ENFP leaders are consensus builders who work hard to gain the trust of their associates, patiently listening to their ideas and reacting enthusiastically to their good suggestions. Their assertive, “can-do” attitude inspires others and motivates them to action.
Strengths.Strong social conscience: Often active in social movements, you stand up for what you believe in without apology. Some people talk the compassion game but don’t follow through with meaningful action, but you believe it is vitally important to back up caring words with good deeds. Despite their friendly nature, an ENFP will go supernova with righteous anger when you are exposed to suffering and injustice. You can get quite loud and assertive if that’s what it takes to get their opinions heard.

Weaknesses.Hypersensitivity: You sometimes let their imaginations run wild and often perceive bad intentions that don’t really exist. Being hyper-alert and aware helps you improve their social comprehension, but reading between the lines only works when something is actually hidden there. If it isn’t, misunderstandings can occur and hurt feelings can damage good relationships.
Weaknesses.Lack of focus and follow-through: You are endlessly creative, capable of filling a thousand days with a thousand bold ideas. But you don’t always follow through on their inspirations, and if others are not brought on board to handle the details, their best ideas may never be put into practice. You rely on their initial excitement and passion too much and don’t always show the discipline necessary to translate their ideas into real-world production. You have a tendency to start new projects before the last ones are finished, and failing to see things through is where you sometimes come up short.
Weaknesses.Overthink things: You have a tendency to perceive slights, resentments or hostility where none actually exist, and your habit of overanalyzing other people’s behaviour can lead to unnecessary anger and conflict. If you aren’t receiving as many compliments as you expect from your significant others, your insecurities can be activated and you may start to feel unappreciated and unloved.
While emotional expression is a core part of you's identity, you can come on too strong. The bubbly, energetic style of you doesn’t mesh well with every partner and introverts, in particular, can sometimes feel steamrolled in their presence. You are also approval-seekers, and in your desire to receive praise and acknowledgement you may try a little too hard to make a good impression, talking too much and listening too little in the process.

Personality Description.Name: The Victor
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You're an enthusiastic being who loves using their communication style  to bring life to a party!
Personality Description.Description:
You are people-centred creators with a focus on possibilities and contagious enthusiasm for new ideas, people and activities. Energetic, warm, and passionate, you love to help other people explore their creative potential.
You are typically agile and expressive communicators, using their wit, humour, and mastery of language to create engaging stories. Imaginative and original, you often have a strong artistic side. You are drawn to art because of its ability to express inventive ideas and create a deeper understanding of human experience.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You are sociable and outgoing.
2. You draw your energy from the outside world.
3. You talk about your thoughts and feelings and have great communication skills.
4. You are adaptable to every situation and are innovative when problems arise.
5. You are good at multitasking and prefer to work in a team rather than individually.
6. You look for inspiration and ideas from outside sources.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are imaginative and think out of the box.
2. You are innovative, hypothetical and have a futuristic approach towards life.
3. You are highly observant and a deep thinker.
4. You are aware of yourself and your surroundings.
5. You prefer to read between the lines and recognise the connection between random facts
6. Ideas inspire you and you are more likely to focus on the theory than the practice of a project.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You decide with heart and dislike conflict.
2. You are passionate and driven by emotion.
3. You are empathetic and like taking care of others.
4. You pay attention to your moral compass to determine right from wrong and are less interested in the cold, hard facts.
5. You consider the effect of your actions on other people
6. you are concerned with values and what is best for the people involved.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You are spontaneous with the given tasks.
2. You are a Multitasker.
3. You don't need a plan or clarity to start work.
4. You want to be independent.
5. You dislike structure and are carefree.
6. You tend to be flexible and adaptable.
7. You always keep your options open.

ENFP.Communication Style: You are enthusiastic, collaborative communicators who love exploring possibilities for people. You often enjoy getting to know other people and understanding what inspires them and you are insightful about solutions to personal problems. Highly empathic, you can find something to identify within almost every person you meet and enjoy encouraging other people to develop and grow. You are typically optimistic and like to talk about opportunities for the future, motivating others to join them in your vision.
ENFP.Values and Motivations:
You tend to be curious about others and preoccupied with discovering the deeper meaning in people and ideas. You want an authentic experience and often seek emotional intensity. You are easily bored by details and repetition and seek out situations that offer an escape from the mundane. Novelty is attractive to you, who often have a wide range of interests and friends from many backgrounds.
You prize individuality and often consider the pursuit of happiness to be the highest priority in life, both for yourself and for others. You place great importance on personal freedom and self-expression and want to be able to go wherever inspiration leads.
ENFP.Work Place Habits:
At work, you are concerned with using their creativity to express themselves and benefit others. You want to explore the possibilities for themselves and other people and approach their work with vision and inspiration. You enjoy taking on creative or people-centred problems that call for an imaginative, original solution.
You are often motivated by their beliefs in humanitarian causes and want work that is consistent with their values. You are particularly interested in helping other people develop as individuals. You tend to choose careers that allow them to pursue ideals of personal growth and artistic expression.
You dislike routine work and want a variety of tasks and challenges. You prefer to set their own schedule and chafe when saddled with excessive regulations or mundane details. You seek out fun, novel tasks that allow them to be imaginative and relate to other people in an unstructured, supportive way.
The ideal work environment for you is relaxed and friendly, with few restrictions on creativity. The ideal job for you allows them to follow their inspiration, satisfy their curiosity, and develop solutions that benefit people in innovative and original ways.
ENFP.How Others Perceive You:
You love to talk about people: not just the facts, but what motivates them, what inspires them, and what you envision achieving in life. You’ll often share their own aspirations freely, and want to hear others’ in return. You are unlikely to judge anyone’s dream and will discuss the most imaginative and outlandish of fantasies with warm, enthusiastic intensity. You love to explore creative possibilities, and nothing deflates them faster than talking about dry facts or harsh reality.
You often seem unconventional, and may come off as scattered; you don’t tend to be in touch with their physical surroundings. You often overlook the details, as you are more likely to focus on connecting with other people or on exploring their own imagination and self-expression. You have little patience for the mundane and want to experience life with intensity and flair. You often have an artistic streak and may be artistic in appearance. Many have developed a distinctive and quirky personal style.

Growth Potential.Accept the fact that if it looks like a: You are intuitive and have a sharp eye for detail. You make a mistake, however, when you insist on looking for hidden motivations or covert agendas everywhere. In normal social encounters, you should make a real effort to give everyone the benefit of the doubt and take words and actions at face value. Assuming the worst can be a self-fulfilling prophecy since people will eventually sense your mistrust and return it in kind.
Growth Potential.Take the foot off the accelerator: In social situations, that is. When you are tempted to turn on the charm just a bit more or pick up the intensity in their presentation style, you would be wise to resist those urges. Smiling and nodding and listening are excellent communication tools. Interestingly, because you are so good with words, you actually need fewer of them to make their points or establish solid human connections in most instances.
Growth Potential.Don\u2019t shirk the \u201cdirty\u201d w: You don’t always see projects through to the end, preferring to hop from one endeavour to another like a hungry hummingbird flitting through a juicy flower patch. So every once in a while, as a change of pace, you should make it a point to maintain tight control all the way to the finish. Detail work and project management do not always come naturally to you. But you have the insight and know-how to handle all the small stuff if you just make the decision to put their noses to the grindstone and keep them there until the process is complete.
Growth Potential.Look inside for validation: You enjoy compliments and try very hard to please, and this has a subtle, and not entirely positive, the effect on your behaviour. When you pay too much attention to the opinions of others, it can prevent you from following your own instincts and leave them open to manipulation. “If being true to myself gets me in hot water, then so be it”—that is what you should tell yourself when you start worrying too much about what other people think.
Growth Potential.Find good partners: Because you are a little lax with the details, you need assistants and co-workers who can handle the duties you tend to overlook. You enjoy working in teams so it should not be a big stretch to form relationships or partnerships with people whose skills complement their own. In their personal lives, you can also benefit from making connections with those who are good at the aspects of life you neglect. This could certainly be said about any of us, but you have a strong independent streak and may not reach out to others for help as often as you should.

Strengths.Strong-willed: One thing that is especially admirable about you is your near imperviousness to criticism. Once you have formed a position or made a decision, you don’t buckle under pressure. You are just that certain of the rightness of your beliefs and the deft logic that brought you there. To sway you, people must either outsmart you or prove you wrong. You don’t mind being criticized, don’t take things personally and are not afraid to hold the outside opinion.
Strengths.Efficient: You are known for your sheer productivity, efficiency and focus, often being able to handle many tasks without dropping or defaulting on any of them. You have limitless energy for your work and they produce more than favourable results. You often obtain what they go after because they are not easily discouraged, even when your plans or positions don’t seem to be working or take longer than expected. You believe they cannot fail.
Strengths.Strategic thinking: You are sharp thinkers and remarkable problem solvers. They tend to have great ideas and are able to examine the situation from every angle and strategically map out a plan in order to achieve your vision. Rather than being overwhelmed by problems, they are energized by them. These qualities combine with your strong conceptual skills to ensure that every project moves forward with smart, long-term solutions.
Strengths.Charismatic leaders: You live in a world of possibilities and see challenges everywhere that they gladly attack. They are leaders in the best sense, using your energy and charisma to inspire and motivate others. People often choose you to be their leaders, and this allows you to achieve ambitious plans they could never achieve on their own.

Weaknesses.Blunt and dominant: Given your logical way of thinking, it's no surprise that you are expert at finding flaws and holes. But when combined with your characteristic bluntness and lack of regard for the feelings of others, it can make them appear critical, nitpicky and unrelenting. Not everyone will appreciate having your flaws so frequently picked out and put on display.
Weaknesses.Intolerant: You hold others to their same impossible standards, believing everyone can and should work as hard as they do. They often lack patience for people who are naturally less direct or a bit slower. “It’s my way or the highway” can be an intimidating mantra for those on the sharp end of your criticism
Weaknesses.Arrogant: You respect strategic thinking, quick wits and decisive action, and look down on those who don’t match up. While being sure of yourself can only be a good thing, it often translates to arrogance, especially in the eyes of those who have not put in as much effort and don’t have the same courage in their convictions.
Weaknesses.Poor handling of emotions: Empathy is not one of the strengths of the ENTJ. This type tends to be impatient when others refuse or are unable to see things from your perspective, and it requires active attention from you to recognize the value of others' opinions and to take your feelings into account. In a personal environment, you can behave imperiously and trample over others’ feelings, which made not win them any friends.

Personality Description.Name: The Innovator
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You're someone who has got 'an eye for detail' and love coming up with creative solutions to problems.
Personality Description.Description:
You are strategic leaders, motivated to organize change. You are quick to see inefficiency and conceptualize new solutions and enjoy developing long-range plans to accomplish their vision. You excel at logical reasoning and are usually articulate and quick-witted.
You are analytical and objective and like bringing order to the world around you. When there are flaws in a system, you see them and enjoy the process of discovering and implementing a better way. You are assertive and enjoy taking charge; you see their role as that of leader and manager, organizing people and processes to achieve their goals.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You are sociable and outgoing.
2. You draw your energy from the outside world.
3. You talk about your thoughts and feelings and have great communication skills.
4. You are adaptable to every situation and are innovative when problems arise.
5. You are good at multitasking and prefer to work in a team rather than individually.
6. You look for inspiration and ideas from outside sources.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are imaginative and think out of the box.
2. You are innovative, hypothetical and have a futuristic approach towards life.
3. You are highly observant and a deep thinker.
4. You are aware of yourself and your surroundings.
5. You prefer to read between the lines and recognise the connection between random facts
6. Ideas inspire you and you are more likely to focus on the theory than the practice of a project.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You enjoy technical and scientific fields where logic is important.
2. You look for logical explanations or solutions to everything.
3. You make decisions rationally.
4. You are task-oriented and focused.
5. You are ruled by your head instead of your heart.
6. You are a critical thinker and oriented toward problem-solving.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You prefer being organised and live a planned or orderly way of life.
2. You like to be involved in tasks where there is a standard procedure and do not like ambiguity
3. You like to take charge of things and take responsibilities and leading roles.
4. You are self-disciplined and decisive.
5. You don't procrastinate and complete your work on time.

ENTJ.Communication Style: You are enthusiastic, collaborative communicators who love exploring possibilities for people. You often enjoy getting to know other people and understanding what inspires them and you are insightful about solutions to personal problems. Highly empathic, you can find something to identify within almost every person you meet and enjoy encouraging other people to develop and grow. You are typically optimistic and like to talk about opportunities for the future, motivating others to join them in your vision.
ENTJ.Values and Motivations:
You are often very motivated by success in their careers and enjoy hard work. You are ambitious and interested in gaining power and influence. To you, decision-making is a vocation. You want to be in a position to make the call and put plans into motion.
You tend to be blunt and decisive. Driven to get things done, you can sometimes be critical or brusque in the pursuit of a goal. You are typically friendly and outgoing, although you may not pick up on emotional subtleties in other people. You often love working with others toward a common goal, but may not find time to attend to their feelings. You are focused on results and want to be productive, competent, and influential.
ENTJ.Work Place Habits:
You are drawn to leadership positions that allow you to develop strategies to achieve greater efficiency and productivity. You prefer to be in management or supervisory roles and want the ability to initiate and lead organizational change.
You enjoy the challenge of solving difficult problems and enjoy understanding complex systems so that you can determine where improvement is possible. You naturally see opportunities to improve systems and want to lead teams to carry out your vision. You appreciate an environment where innovation is encouraged, and where traditions are not held sacred.
You want structure in your work. You prefer that your work and that of your colleagues be evaluated based on a set of clear guidelines. You appreciate an environment that is businesslike and fair, where performance is evaluated objectively and rewarded generously. You are typically motivated and hardworking and want to be recognized for your efforts with money, power, and prestige.
An ideal organization for you values competence and logical thinking and includes coworkers who are intelligent and ambitious. An ideal job for you is one that challenges them to address complex problems with strategic planning and clear goal-setting.
ENTJ.How Others Perceive You:
You are a natural leader and often take charge no matter where you are. You typically have a clear vision for the future, and intuitively understand how to move people and processes towards that goal. You tend to approach every situation with the attitude of an efficiency analyst and are not shy about pointing out what could be done better. For you, your ideas are a foregone conclusion: it’s just a matter of time before you can move the players to get everything accomplished.
You are often gregarious and seem to have an idea for how a person will fit into your grand scheme from the moment they are introduced. You are typically direct and may seem presumptuous or even arrogant; You size people and situations up very quickly and have trouble being anything but honest about what you see. You are sensitive to issues of power, and seek positions and people of influence. You are characteristically ambitious, and often very engaged in your careers. More than any other type, you enjoy your work, and may even say that working is what you do for fun.

Growth Potential.Get in touch with emotions\u2014your own: you can stand to intentionally work on raising your EQ a few points. Otherwise, you come off as abrasive and unfeeling and your relationships fail to develop properly. You can make progress by working to consider your own feelings and those of other people, but it won’t come naturally.
Growth Potential.Practice restraint: Yes, it is important to be right, but this isn’t the only concern. It is important to also consider the personal consequences. Truth and results are important, but you will do well to consider how your actions and decisions will affect the people around them or society at large.
Growth Potential.Value people: Ideas, causes and convictions are important, but you will be happier in the long run if you do not completely jettison personal relations and the feelings of others in the quest to be right or to hold to your convictions. And it is possible to enjoy the company and friendship of someone with whom one does not agree on all matters and who also doesn’t desire to argue about it.
Growth Potential.Listen up: You must work on listening and not just for the purpose of arguing in return. You, using your combination of intuition and rapid processing, tend to finish sentences, interrupt, anticipate information and make assumptions. You will benefit by slowing down, listening, waiting for others to finish and trying to pay attention to the details—they might actually be important.
Growth Potential.Relax!: The pace you have is rigorous and you often fail to see the need for leisure or rest. But your work schedule, high intensity and perfectionism can cause you to neglect your health and have negative consequences for you and your families. Thus, it is necessary to build leisure, fun, social interaction and rest into your life without feeling guilty about the time you may be spending away from work. And you are likely to find that your work is better for it in the long run.

Strengths.Fearlessness: One of your greatest strengths and keys to success is your boldness in the face of challenge. These are people who are not afraid to try and fail and try again, perhaps thousands of times; you don’t conceive of it as a failure, merely another step along the path to success. As you invent and innovate, you are undeterred by doubts, you are barely ruffled when outcomes don’t go as planned and you see all “problems” as opportunities to be embraced and pursued.
Strengths.Innovation: In all things—products, procedures and systems—you know there is always a better way and with the right kind of thinking, you will get there. As a result, you may suffer a lot of seeming failures in your lives but will enjoy many successes as well. You can be marvellously rich and lose your entire life savings—perhaps a few times within the course of your lives. You live out loud and take risks.
Strengths.Adaptability: You are generally go-with-the-flow people. This isn’t to say that you are particularly agreeable individuals, but that you are able to adapt to your circumstances and the problems that arise in life and work. You can improvise on the fly and come up with creative solutions rapidly. You deal well with fast-paced and frequent change and enjoy the corresponding challenges.
Strengths.Confidence: Generally speaking, criticism and ostracism have very little effect on you. You are confident in your skills and talents and believe in the power of your ideas. Opposition on the way to success is to be expected and you don’t take it personally; you’d rather prove your detractors wrong.

Weaknesses.Flightiness: That which is a strength can easily become a weakness and this is seen in the case of you and your idea-generating nature. While this can be your greatest strength, it can also mean that you may be flighty and flaky, jumping from one idea to the next and struggling to follow through. your fear of missing out can make it hard to commit to one idea or one path; you want to keep exploring and evaluating.
Weaknesses.Impracticality: You have a chaotic air about them that can range from amusing to aggravating, especially to coworkers and spouses. In your tendency to get caught up in your ideas you often lose sight of the immediate tasks around them such as housework, yard work and other responsibilities of daily living, such as paying bills. You may be stunningly brilliant but also poor, disorganized and seemingly untethered.
Weaknesses.Breaking norms: Nonconformity, while it can be a positive trait, often gets you into trouble. your entire approach to life is founded upon charting your own course, pushing the boundaries and doing things your way. While this leads to great creativity and advances in your fields, it can also put them at odds with authority figures and superiors, which can, in turn, hinder your progress and impede your success. “Incorrigible” and “stubborn” are two words that wouldn’t be out of place in describing you.
Weaknesses.Procrastination: You are also known for your tendencies toward procrastination and poor time management. To some degree, this is a product of your Perceiving component in which you prefer to continue taking in information rather than making a decision and getting down to business. The issue is not necessarily laziness as much as it is a disinclination to stop the intake of ideas and information to move forward with one idea or one decision. You have a hard time prioritizing tasks and will struggle to keep new information and ideas from getting in the way of the work at hand.

Personality Description.Name: The Insightful
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You're one who admires innovators and innovation, and loves bringing new ideas to the table.
Personality Description.Description:
You are inspired by innovators, motivated to find new solutions to intellectually challenging problems. You are curious and clever, and seek to comprehend the people, systems, and principles that surround you. Open-minded and unconventional, Visionaries want to analyze, understand, and influence other people.
You enjoy playing with ideas and especially like to banter with others. You use their quick wit and command of language to keep the upper hand with other people, often cheerfully poking fun at their habits and eccentricities. While you enjoy challenging others, in the end, you are usually happy to live and let live. You are rarely judgmental, but you may have little patience for people who can't keep up.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You are sociable and outgoing.
2. You draw your energy from the outside world.
3. You talk about your thoughts and feelings and have great communication skills.
4. You are adaptable to every situation and are innovative when problems arise.
5. You are good at multitasking and prefer to work in a team rather than individually.
6. You look for inspiration and ideas from outside sources.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are imaginative and think out of the box.
2. You are innovative, hypothetical and have a futuristic approach towards life.
3. You are highly observant and a deep thinker.
4. You are aware of yourself and your surroundings.
5. You prefer to read between the lines and recognise the connection between random facts
6. Ideas inspire you and you are more likely to focus on the theory than the practice of a project.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You enjoy technical and scientific fields where logic is important.
2. You look for logical explanations or solutions to everything.
3. You make decisions rationally.
4. You are task-oriented and focused.
5. You are ruled by your head instead of your heart.
6. You are a critical thinker and oriented toward problem-solving.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You are spontaneous with the given tasks.
2. You are a Multitasker.
3. You don't need a plan or clarity to start work.
4. You want to be independent.
5. You dislike structure and are carefree.
6. You tend to be flexible and adaptable.
7. You always keep your options open.

ENTP.Communication Style: You are lively and agile communicators who speak in terms of the “big idea.” You like to explore possibilities and make connections with the information you receive. You love innovative solutions and are enthusiastic about change, but you are also highly analytical and will not hesitate to criticize ideas that don’t hold up to your logical analysis. You can be hard to keep up with in conversation; you like to play with lots of complex ideas and have little patience for explaining details.
ENTP.Values and Motivations:
You are energized by the challenge and are often inspired by a problem that others perceive as impossible to solve. You are confident in their ability to think creatively, and may assume that others are too tied to tradition to see a new way. The Visionary relies on their ingenuity to deal with the world around you, and rarely finds preparation necessary. You will often jump into a new situation and trust yourself to adapt as you go.
You are masters of re-inventing the wheel and often refuse to do a task the same way twice. You question norms and often ignore them altogether. Established procedures are uninspiring to the Visionary, who would much rather try a new method (or two) than go along with the standard.
ENTP.Work Place Habits:
At work, you are concerned with applying innovative solutions to challenging problems to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of systems. You often take an entrepreneurial approach to your work and you prefer to approach tasks in a casual and unstructured way, with few limitations on your ingenuity.
You prize competency and often want to be the expert. You enjoy work that demands continual improvement in your knowledge and skills. You value power and want a career that allows them to contact powerful people and the opportunity to increase your influence.
You are an ideal person and chafe at routine. You get bored very quickly when required to repeat a task or attend to details. You do best when your work is highly conceptual and allows them to solve problems creatively without having to think through the details.
The ideal work environment for you is intellectually challenging without being rigid, with creative and intelligent coworkers. The ideal job for you allows them to put your creativity to work developing innovative ideas while allowing them to delegate responsibility for the tedious details of implementation to others.
ENTP.How Others Perceive You:
You are typically friendly and often charming. You usually want to be seen as clever and may try to impress others with your quick wit and incisive humour. You are curious about the world around them and want to know how things work. However, for you, the rules of the universe are made to be broken. You like to find the loopholes and figure out how you can work the system to your advantage. This is not to say the Visionary is malicious: you simply find rules limiting, and believe there is probably a better, faster, or more interesting way to do things that haven’t been thought of before.
You are characteristically entrepreneurial and may be quick to share a new business idea or invention. You are confident and creative, and typically excited to discuss your many ingenious ideas. Your enthusiasm for innovation is infectious, and you are often good at getting other people on board with your schemes. However, you are fundamentally “big-picture” people and maybe at a loss when it comes to recalling or describing details. you are typically more excited about exploring a concept than you are about making it a reality, and can seem unreliable if you don’t follow through with your many ideas.

Growth Potential.Do a little more research: You are quick to dive into new projects and ideas headfirst. While this enthusiastic “all in” quality can be a strength, it can also be detrimental when people of this type fail to do the due diligence or to pay adequate attention to the details. You can help avoid wasted time and money by stepping back and investigating first.
Growth Potential.Look at the \u201csmall picture.\u201d: As big-picture people and conceptual thinkers, people of this type are focused on the broad themes and patterns and the big, important projects, often letting the details fall by the wayside. However details—while nothing more than a bother to you—are often essential. You will do well to realize that details often end up eating more time in the long run if neglected or overlooked.
Growth Potential.Learn to adapt to rules and structures: Rules aren’t actually made to be broken, contrary to your belief, and the people who follow them aren’t to be disdained as thoughtless or unintelligent. These boundaries provide order. If everyone disregarded them we’d be living in very different circumstances. You will get along better at work and in society if you can try to have a little respect for authority and follow the rules.
Growth Potential.Stick to it: You generate so many different ideas and interesting options that you simply want to explore them all. While this can be an asset, it also can deter them from simply getting on with the work at hand. At some point, in order to be most productive, you need to make a decision on a course of action, plot the steps to the finish and then just get going.
Growth Potential.Differentiate between the possible and t: You often don’t properly distinguish between these two categories and thus find yourself spending a wealth of resources pursuing something that, though possible, is not at all probable. People of this type will do well to factor in the feasibility of various ideas when considering your many options.

Strengths.Strong practical skills: Good intentions are wonderful, but they don’t mean much unless they’re backed up by a well- organized plan of action. You understand how to accomplish tasks better than most, and that is why the to-do lists you make are seldom left with any unchecked items. you are so conscientious and detail-oriented you can’t stomach the thought of leaving an important job or project only half-finished, and you would feel embarrassed if you gave anything less than your very best effort in each and every instance.
Strengths.Warm and sensitive: With grand and gentle hearts, you form lasting emotional bonds and make strong empathic connections with others. When someone needs guidance, you will be by their side, supporting them with advice that is concrete, sensible and guaranteed to produce good results. No problem is too big or too small to arouse the interest of you, and regardless of what a friend, loved one or acquaintance is going through, you will do your best to provide impactful assistance.
Strengths.Loyal and dutiful: You are a traditionalist right down to the core. You are concerned with protecting the best parts of the existing social order against the forces of “progress”, and always honour the wisdom of your elders, always put the interests of others before your own. Doing the right thing every time doesn’t make life easy, but you are incapable of following the path of least resistance when people need help or moral issues are involved.
Strengths.Stand up and be counted: You aren’t intimidated by challenges and you aren’t willing to just sit by and wait for others to take the lead. Inside your social and community circles, you are always willing to step up and lend a helping hand; in support of great causes you will organize, volunteer, recruit, fundraise, run for election, put up flyers, go door-to-door or give speeches on street corners— sometimes all in the same week!

Weaknesses.Rigid and judgmental: While you are tolerant in general, you don’t approach the world with a completely open mind. Your value systems are defined by fixed ideas about right and wrong, good and bad, smart and foolish, and you tend to categorize everything you see according to such dualistic concepts. “Live and let live” is not a concept that appeals to you, who are not shy about judging the behaviour and character of others based on brief initial impressions.
Weaknesses.Reluctant to improvise: You have a lot of respect for rules, laws, regulations and traditional codes of conduct—a world without shoulds and shouldn’t and dos and don’ts would be unsustainable and chaotic to the traditionalist you. But in some instances, outside the box thinking may be required. You can be slow to recognize this reality, making you rigid and unyielding when a bit more openness to change is called for.
Weaknesses.Neediness: You have a strong need to be noticed, acknowledged and appreciated, and you want others to see you as helpful, trustworthy and virtuous. This means that your sense of self-worth will rise or fall based on the amount of praise or criticism you get from others. You aren’t worried about what other people will think every minute of the day, but you do take rejection very personally and have a hard time getting over any perceived slight.
Weaknesses.Lack of creative thinking: Too often, you are so focused on the here and now you miss opportunities for growth and improvement that are staring you right in the face. A long view that embraces creative inspirations, abstract ideas and big picture thinking can allow you to reach new levels of understanding, but taking your intellects in this direction does not come naturally to you. A failure to respect the benefits of the creative power of the imagination can keep you stuck in patterns of thought and behaviour that have long outlived your usefulness.

Personality Description.Name: The Contributor
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You're diligent and empathetic who admires obedience and gives importance to your loved ones.
Personality Description.Description:
You are conscientious helpers, sensitive to the needs of others and energetically dedicated to their responsibilities. You are highly attuned to their emotional environment and attentive to both the feelings of others and the perception others have of you. You like a sense of harmony and cooperation around You, and are eager to please and provide.
You value loyalty and tradition, and usually make their family and friends their top priority. You are generous with their time, effort, and emotions. You often take on the concerns of others as if they were their own, and will attempt to put their significant organizational talents to use to bring order to other people's lives.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You are sociable and outgoing.
2. You draw your energy from the outside world.
3. You talk about your thoughts and feelings and have great communication skills.
4. You are adaptable to every situation and are innovative when problems arise.
5. You are good at multitasking and prefer to work in a team rather than individually.
6. You look for inspiration and ideas from outside sources.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are observant.
2. Your decisions depend on facts and figures.
3. You are rational and realistic.
4. You focus on the present and have a reasonable approach.
5. You use experience and common sense to solve problems.
6. You apply all your senses.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You decide with heart and dislike conflict.
2. You are passionate and driven by emotion.
3. You are empathetic and like taking care of others.
4. You pay attention to your moral compass to determine right from wrong and are less interested in the cold, hard facts.
5. You consider the effect of your actions on other people
6. you are concerned with values and what is best for the people involved.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You prefer being organised and live a planned or orderly way of life.
2. You like to be involved in tasks where there is a standard procedure and do not like ambiguity
3. You like to take charge of things and take responsibilities and leading roles.
4. You are self-disciplined and decisive.
5. You don't procrastinate and complete your work on time.

ESFJ.Communication Style: You are an enthusiastic and caring communicator, who wants to engage people to contribute and accomplish what needs to be done. You tend to be friendly and to get along easily with others, although you can become frustrated with those who do not respond to your attempts to reach out. You have a good memory for detail, especially facts about other people, and enjoy getting to know people and understanding your needs. You are factual in your communication, but generally uncomfortable with criticism and conflict, preferring instead to provide support and encouragement to others.
ESFJ.Values and Motivations:
You act according to a strict moral code and look for others to do the same. You often see things in terms of black and white, right and wrong, and you are typically not shy about sharing their evaluations of others' behaviour. You seek harmony and cooperation and feel this is best accomplished when everyone follows the same set of rules. You have a sense of order in the way people relate to one another, and often take on roles that allow you to help enforce that social order.
You feel a sense of personal responsibility for other people's needs and are usually eager to get involved and help out. You tend to be serious and practical, dutifully putting business before pleasure—especially the business of caring for others. You typically enjoy routine and often keep a regular schedule that allows you to be organized and productive.
ESFJ.Work Place Habits:
You like to put your interpersonal skills to work to organize people and processes. You are tuned into the needs of others and seek to create a structure to provide for people. You often prefer work that allows you to help people in practical, observable ways.
You enjoy work that allows you to follow through and see results and prefer a high degree of structure and organization. You gain satisfaction from completing tasks with attention to order and detail. An ideal job for you requires attention to procedure and specifications and allows you to work methodically to organize people and processes.
You usually prefer to work with others and are energized by participating in a motivated, conscientious, action-oriented team. It is important for you to do work that is accordant with your values, as well as to work with others who are supportive and cooperative. An ideal work environment for you provides clear expectations and a friendly, structured atmosphere free from conflict or uncertainty.
ESFJ.How Others Perceive You:
You may often be found playing host or hostess. you tend to take on the role of organizer without hesitation, and want to be sure that everyone is taken care of. Roles such as committee leader, event planner, and church volunteer suit you well. You are typically engaged with your communities and work hard to do your part in maintaining the social order. You are interested in other people and like to know the details of your lives. Gossip is a favourite pastime of many you; you love to share stories about the people around you.
You have a clear moral code that guides your behaviour and your expectations from others. you often have strong opinions about how people should behave and the proper thing to do. Manners and other codes of social interaction are often of great interest to you. You may think in terms of black and white, right and wrong. You can be judgmental of others who you do not think are acting appropriately, but you have the best of intentions: you simply want everyone to follow the rules so you can all get along. You want things to be all right with the people around you and may become very involved with others’ problems and concerns.

Growth Potential.Get some emotional separation: Helping others gives you enormous satisfaction but, like sponges, you absorb the anxieties of others as if those troubles were your own. Unfortunately, this is emotionally exhausting and can put a huge strain on you who may become so preoccupied with the suffering and angst of your loved ones that you lose sight of your own personal needs. In the long run, you would be more effective if you could learn to put some emotional distance between yourself and the people you choose to assist.
Fish are going to swim, birds are going to fly, and you are going to make judgments about people and events based on your own exacting standards. But just because you possess this trait doesn’t mean you have to indulge it in every single instance. If you can learn to detach just a bit from your initial impressions, you will have a much easier time altering your judgments as more information comes in.
Growth Potential.Remember that no one can please all of t: You crave the favourable opinions of others and you always go the extra mile to please. But trying to satisfy everyone in every circumstance is impossible, no matter how friendly or accommodating you might be. The sooner you realize this the better off you will be. Like anything else, it takes practice to change attitudes, but learning to accept occasional rejection can help you find greater harmony and peace of mind.
Growth Potential.Practice solo hobbies: You can become overly dependent on other people, to the point where you feel ill-at-ease if there is no one around to talk to. We all need some alone time where we can reflect in peace and silence. Solitary hobbies and activities that require quiet concentration and promote self-reliance are highly recommended for you, who need to get in touch with your feelings and figure out how to get by without constant outside feedback.
Growth Potential.Learn a little more about how rules, law: You obey the rules and respect traditional ways. But rather than just accepting them without question, you should consider studying up to understand where they actually came from. Ideas we take for granted now were fresh and innovative at some point in the past, and you often represented a clean break from previous assumptions. Discovering where “self-evident truths” and “common sense” really came from can help you broaden your perspective. And if this makes you a little more open to new ideas in the present, it will be a positive development all the way around.

Strengths.Showmanship: You have lively personalities which you use to liven up every room you occupy. Bringing smiles and enjoyment to others gives you greater satisfaction than anything else in the world. Being cheerful, entertaining and humorous comes naturally to you, and the people who know you best realize your interest in the happiness of others is sincere and motivated by empathetic and compassionate instincts.
Strengths.Supportive: You do like to be the centre of attention, but you also prize the spirit of cooperation and never try to hog the spotlight when asked to work on group projects. It is really the social give-and-take that you enjoy the most, and if you act as facilitators in cooperative situations it is only because your outgoing natures predispose them to take the lead. As teammates or partners, you will always listen to what everyone has to say, will never try to force your ideas on anyone.
Strengths.Positivity: You are the quintessential positive thinkers, firmly believing the bright side is the only one worth looking at. You see every minute of wasted time as a lost opportunity, and you can’t stand to throw away chances for fun, conversation, excitement or unique experience. Furthermore, you do a fantastic job of passing on your enthusiasm and hopefulness to your companions, and that is why some of the most admired self-help gurus and motivational speakers come from your ranks.
Strengths.Bold and practical: Because you refuse to live in the past or the future or get distracted by dreams or fantasies about the way the world should be, you are high-quality practical workers who never sacrifice your determination to accomplish remarkable things in the present moment. You want desperately to help others, but you also want to see results from your efforts immediately and aren’t willing to be patient. You will put the pedal to the metal in a heartbeat if you see opportunities to make a constructive impact in the lives of the people you care about most.

Weaknesses.Avoid conflict: The one problem with “glass half full” types is that you will sometimes deny unpleasant truths or avoid uncomfortable situations if you feel it might cast a dark cloud. You hate buzzkills, and this makes them a bit squeamish about conflict, persistent social problems and a variety of other unfortunate circumstances that can’t be wished away or overcome with a cheerful attitude.
Weaknesses.Sensitive: It is ironic given your tendency to showmanship and outspokenness, but you are extremely sensitive and can be deeply hurt when others criticize your ideas, personalities or conduct. You have a tough time seeing such criticism as constructive, and you usually react with anger and resentment when you feel someone is questioning or attacking them.
Weaknesses.Easily bored: With a need for constant excitement, you find it hard to maintain your focus on the topic at hand; often demonstrating the sort of attention span normally seen only in kindergarten classrooms. This can make you appear flighty and unfocused. Life is not a non-stop party, and you do need to knuckle down if you are to turn your high energy into an accomplished goal.
Weaknesses.Poor long-term focus: When given the choice between theory and proven practice, you will choose the latter every time. You distrust abstract concepts, future hypotheses and big picture projections and this makes you poor long-term planners. You aren’t as good at recognizing alternatives as you should be, and this can blind them to exciting possibilities for growth, evolution and constructive change.

Personality Description.Name: The Artist
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You're someone who appreciates the little things in life and are typically warm and enthusiastic.
Personality Description.Description:
You are vivacious entertainers who charm and engage those around you. You are spontaneous, energetic, and fun-loving, and take pleasure in the things around you: food, clothes, nature, animals, and especially people.
You are typically warm and talkative and have a contagious enthusiasm for life. You like to be in the middle of the action and the centre of attention. You have a playful, open sense of humour, and like to draw out other people and help them have a good time.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You are sociable and outgoing.
2. You draw your energy from the outside world.
3. You talk about your thoughts and feelings and have great communication skills.
4. You are adaptable to every situation and are innovative when problems arise.
5. You are good at multitasking and prefer to work in a team rather than individually.
6. You look for inspiration and ideas from outside sources.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are observant.
2. Your decisions depend on facts and figures.
3. You are rational and realistic.
4. You focus on the present and have a reasonable approach.
5. You use experience and common sense to solve problems.
6. You apply all your senses.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You decide with heart and dislike conflict.
2. You are passionate and driven by emotion.
3. You are empathetic and like taking care of others.
4. You pay attention to your moral compass to determine right from wrong and are less interested in the cold, hard facts.
5. You consider the effect of your actions on other people
6. you are concerned with values and what is best for the people involved.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You are spontaneous with the given tasks.
2. You are a Multitasker.
3. You don't need a plan or clarity to start work.
4. You want to be independent.
5. You dislike structure and are carefree.
6. You tend to be flexible and adaptable.
7. You always keep your options open.

ESFP.Communication Style: You are an enthusiastic and caring communicator, who wants to engage people to contribute and accomplish what needs to be done. You tend to be friendly and to get along easily with others, although you can become frustrated with those who do not respond to your attempts to reach out. You have a good memory for detail, especially facts about other people, and enjoy getting to know people and understanding your needs. You are factual in your communication, but generally uncomfortable with criticism and conflict, preferring instead to provide support and encouragement to others.
ESFP.Values and Motivations:
You live in the moment, enjoying what life has to offer. You are especially tuned in to their senses and take pleasure in the sights, sounds, smells, and textures around you. You like to keep busy, filling their lives with hobbies, sports, activities, and friends. Because you'd rather live spontaneously than plan ahead, you can become overextended when there are too many exciting things to do. And you hate nothing more than missing out on the fun.
Although you are characteristically fun-loving, you are also typically practical and down-to-earth. You are grounded in reality and are usually keenly aware of the facts and details in their environment, especially as you pertain to people. You are observant of others and their needs and responsive in offering assistance. You enjoy helping other people, especially in practical, tangible ways.
ESFP.Work Place Habits:
At work, you want to be hands-on and in the middle of the action. You prefer an active, social work environment where you are free to be spontaneous and have fun, with co-workers who are friendly, laid-back, and enthusiastic.
You are pragmatic, realistic, and tuned into the needs of others. You often choose a job that allows them to be of service to people, and where you can see real, tangible results for your efforts. You are talented at solving practical, people-centred problems, and can put this skill to good use in assisting others.
You are keenly tuned in to your senses and often have an artistic streak. You may choose careers that engage your sensual nature through food, textiles, art, or music. You often want a career that allows them to move around, and generally prefer a work environment that is aesthetically pleasing.
You are stressed by strict rules or excessive bureaucracy at work and want the flexibility to address situations as they arise. You generally focus on the demands of the present moment and do not usually like to work on long-term projects, preferring work that has immediate and tangible results.
ESFP.How Others Perceive You:
You are often the life of the party, entertaining and engaging others with humour and enthusiasm. You notice whether other people are having fun, and do your best to create a good time for all. Typically at home in your physical environment, you may take the lead in getting everyone involved in some active diversion. You are generally friendly and likeable, but can be hard to get close to; although you tend to be very open, you are reluctant to be serious or to talk about anything negative.
You are tuned into your senses and often gravitate towards pleasing colours and textures in your environments. You often carefully choose fabrics and decorations with which to surround themselves. This attention also often translates into your appearance; you are often dressed in sensuous fabrics or bright, dazzling colours. You are often up on the latest trends and like to excite the people around you with new environments and experiences.

Growth Potential.Make lists and write down goals: Too often, the spontaneity and impulsivity of you lead you astray. To avoid spur-of-the-moment decision making, you should try to set goals and organize your activities ahead of time, possibly with the assistance of written lists and schedules. This would give them a clear life plan to refer back to, keeping them on the straight and narrow when faced with temptation.
Growth Potential.Don\u2019t ignore the long-term conseque: By focusing on practical matters so intently, you sometimes waste chances to improve your lives and establish long-term goals. We all need to broaden our horizons and step back so we can see things from a greater perspective. You would benefit from undertaking a meaningful dialogue with the dreamers, creators and visionaries in your lives. The more relationships you can form with big picture thinkers the better off you will be.
Growth Potential.Assume it\u2019s all constructive critic: You are sensitive to criticism of all types. You take it personally and often react with resentment and defensiveness. This is not an easy personality trait to subdue but, with practice, you can reprogram your thinking patterns, becoming less reactive and more open-minded over time. As a starting point, you should attempt to convince yourself that all the criticism you receive is meant to be constructive—which it might very well be. If you can reach this point, your personal growth is all but ensured.
Growth Potential.Investigate alternative learning strateg: You often have a hard time functioning in formal academic environments, where it is impossible to escape from the abstract and the theoretical. You prefer practical, hands-on learning that will help them develop specific skills that can be applied in real-world situations.  Fortunately, there are alternative learning environments that can provide a you-friendly learning experience—internships, apprenticeships, trade schools or technical colleges, individualized study programs at online universities. You could benefit tremendously if you ventured away from the traditional educational model and forged your own path.
Growth Potential.Shine a flashlight into the darkest corn: You are notorious for avoiding unpleasant topics or situations. But running from trouble actually empowers it, allowing it to ruin relationships if tensions are left unaddressed. Instead of avoiding things that make you uncomfortable, you would be better off to confront them, before you have the chance to do any real damage. A positive attitude should not be used as an excuse for denial, which is always a bad idea no matter the circumstances.

You are planners and list makers—orderly and scheduled. Your brain naturally imposes structure on your lives and on your time. You enjoy creating order out of chaos and are always punctual. This contributes to the perception others have of you as reliable, dependable and steady.
Strengths.Dedication and commitment: No one could accuse you of shirking, and it’s natural for this type to give 110 per cent in all areas of life and exhibit boundless energy as you do. You’d sooner sacrifice your personal time or preferences than renege on a commitment or fail to submit your best work. Employers can count on you to uphold the vision of the organization at all times, to work at full speed and to encourage others to do the same.
Strengths.Integrity: You demonstrate consistent integrity in roles of leadership, believing the rules apply as much to you as your subordinates. And though you skillfully exercise authority, you also show great respect for your own superiors and don’t struggle to follow orders. You see that organizations and societies function best when there is a healthy sense of respect and duty.
Strengths.Stewardship: You are the gatekeeper of society. You are like people who feel personally responsible for upholding the standard and formulating a very clear picture of what passes and what doesn’t. As such, you can always be counted on to uphold the laws, rules, regulations and ordinances that keep society structured and functioning smoothly. On the home front, you are committed to your families and desire to provide well for anyone you consider to be under your care.

Weaknesses.Judgmental: A black-and-white approach to life can be a significant pitfall for you. While you are commendably committed to your beliefs, you often forget that all of the principles you espouse are neither universal nor objective, and the traditional, time-honoured way isn’t the only way. You may fail to see that innovation can be beneficial and can be impatient with people who choose non-conventional lifestyles, coming across as judgmental or narrow-minded as a result.
Weaknesses.Uncomfortable with emotions: You often fail to value emotions or take feelings into account—your own and others’—and this can make you appear harsh, abrasive, utilitarian and uncaring. Your typically low EQ may lead you to misjudge the intentions of others and to be equally misunderstood. You often have little patience for people who think or act intuitively or who react emotionally, seeing these as liabilities rather than potential strengths.
Weaknesses.Workaholism: While your work ethic is to be commended, people of this type can also err on the side of workaholism and perfectionism. Your Type A personality and intensity can be a little hard for others to take, as you are often quite unsympathetic to those who may not work as hard or as “perfectly” as you do.
Weaknesses.Stubborn and inflexible: You are committed to your own way or perspective as objectively right, and this can impede the process of personal growth. In fact, you are often so firmly planted in your original belief, as well as your own rightness, that you fail to acknowledge new or conflicting information that would lead to an altered and perhaps truer conclusion. The rigidity can keep you from being truly open-minded and your practical approach to thinking and life, in general, may stifle your ability to think imaginatively or to exercise vision.

Personality Description.Name: The Manager
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You possess an industrialistic outlook on life and love working on projects systematically without being lazy or laid back.
Personality Description.Description:
You are hardworking traditionalists, eager to take charge in organizing projects and people. Orderly, rule-abiding, and conscientious, you like to get things done, and tend to go about projects in a systematic, methodical way.
You are the consummate organizers and want to bring structure to their surroundings. You value predictability and prefer things to proceed in a logical order. When you see a lack of organization, you often take the initiative to establish processes and guidelines, so that everyone knows what's expected
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You are sociable and outgoing.
2. You draw your energy from the outside world.
3. You talk about your thoughts and feelings and have great communication skills.
4. You are adaptable to every situation and are innovative when problems arise.
5. You are good at multitasking and prefer to work in a team rather than individually.
6. You look for inspiration and ideas from outside sources.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are observant.
2. Your decisions depend on facts and figures.
3. You are rational and realistic.
4. You focus on the present and have a reasonable approach.
5. You use experience and common sense to solve problems.
6. You apply all your senses.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You enjoy technical and scientific fields where logic is important.
2. You look for logical explanations or solutions to everything.
3. You make decisions rationally.
4. You are task-oriented and focused.
5. You are ruled by your head instead of your heart.
6. You are a critical thinker and oriented toward problem-solving.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You prefer being organised and live a planned or orderly way of life.
2. You like to be involved in tasks where there is a standard procedure and do not like ambiguity
3. You like to take charge of things and take responsibilities and leading roles.
4. You are self-disciplined and decisive.
5. You don't procrastinate and complete your work on time.

ESTJ.Communication Style: You are a practical, action-oriented communicator. You often assume control and communicate to organize and determine what needs to be done. You are clear about expectations and procedures; you explain the necessary steps as well as how and when tasks should be completed. You are open to debate and criticism, but want rules to be followed and work to get done. You are focused on tasks and results and have little patience for deviation or nonconformity.
ESTJ.Values and Motivations:
You are conventional, factual, and grounded in reality. For you, the proof is in the past: what has worked and what has been done before. You value evidence over conjecture and trust their personal experience. You look for rules to follow and standards to meet and often take a leadership role in helping other people meet expectations as well. You concern yourself with maintaining the social order and keeping others in the line.
You often take on a project manager role at home as well as at work, and excel at setting goals, making decisions, and organizing resources to accomplish a task. You want to achieve efficient productivity and typically believe this is best accomplished when people and systems are well organized.
ESTJ.Work Place Habits:
At work, you excel at organizing—people, projects, and operations. You like to be in control and often seek out management positions, preferring to be in a role where you can make decisions and enforce policies and procedures.
You quickly develop a reputation in the workplace as people who can be trusted to deliver, on time and as requested. You are unfailingly reliable and gain satisfaction from bringing a project to completion. Because of your eagerness to take on responsibility, you sometimes become overworked.
The ideal work environment for you is highly structured, with a clear set of expectations and an organized authority structure. The ideal job for you allows you to use your organizational skills within a set of standardized procedures to efficiently produce a tangible product.
ESTJ.How Others Perceive You:
You command a situation, with the sense that you know how things should go and are ready to take charge to make sure that it happens. You are task-oriented and put work before play.
