Confident and tough-minded, you appears almost always to be in control. You appreciate structure and often begin to organize as soon as you enter a room. You want to establish the ground rules and make sure everyone does what they’re supposed to.
You are often involved in institutions: clubs, associations, societies, and churches, where you usually take a leadership role. You typically connect with others through sharing ritual and routine. Social interaction for you often means following an established tradition to engage with others in a structured way. You tend to respect and seek out the hierarchy. You want to know who’s in charge and will assign levels of responsibility if none exist. Once a structure is in place, you typically trust authority figures and expect obedience from people of lower rank.

Growth Potential.Withhold judgment: You may be quite sure you have the motive, intent, outcome and conclusion figured out before you’ve received even a fraction of the details, and fail to acknowledge that he or she may not have the whole story. You will do well to hold off a bit before delivering a snap judgment or assessment. Focus on asking more questions, waiting for more details and acknowledging that as certain as you are, there may be things you are not seeing.
Growth Potential.Live and let live: You often don’t realize that your way isn’t the only way and that other personalities have much to contribute and should not be dismissed. The you that can bend a little might find that flexibility and openness isn’t such a bad thing. There is really no need to be stubborn just for the sake of it.
Growth Potential.Be more self-critical: You have a tendency to think you are always right and that your moral compass is objective, absolute and universal. But your objectivity isn’t always objective as it appears—you have a standard that feels objective to you, often due to “how it’s always been done.” You would benefit from realizing that personal objectivity is, by definition, somewhat subjective, and spending some time examining the bases of your beliefs.
Growth Potential.Get in touch with your feelings: You need to work on acknowledging your own feelings and being a little more careful with the feelings of others. While it may seem that it’s “not personal,” it may be to a subordinate or a child. Harshness and rigidity can drive away good employees and estrange family members, so make a point to recognize the gifts and talents of others and to be intentional in showing appreciation for these talents.
Growth Potential.Take it easy: You need to work on stress relief and intentionally taking it easy. While you don’t want to be seen as lazy, it helps to remember that leisure and rest are not signs of sloth, but normal ways in which humans recharge. You benefit from taking vacations that really are vacations (not endless activity, planning and tourism) and to practice forced rest. Practices such as yoga, tai chi and meditation can help.

Strengths.Can-do attitude: No one will ever call you lazy or uncertain, and this very self-assured, can-do approach to life and work is certainly a strength. People of this type spend more time acting than thinking, and while this may seem potentially unwise and hasty, you actually process information very rapidly and have a knack for improvising as you go. This makes you excellent in emergency situations as you think on the fly and respond reflexively.
Strengths.Bold: You also abound in mental toughness and sense of competition that makes you relentless in pursuing what you are after. You respond well to your physical environment and know how to manoeuvre your world. You are efficient, clever, bold and driven. And as a result, you often get what you are after and aren’t afraid to take a few risks to get there.
Strengths.Personable and sociable: You are people-focused and get along well with just about anyone. You are observant and perceptive, and you read people well. This has the benefit of helping others to feel that you are cared about because you pays attention and responds appropriately. Though you may not always pick up on or prioritize emotional cues, you are quick to notice and respond to tangible needs.
Strengths.Direct: You are efficient, a matter of fact, direct and to the point. You don’t mince words or want to spend a lot of time hemming and hawing. Many people appreciate your honesty and even your bluntness; you always know where they stand with you. You aren’t afraid to call it as you see it.

Weaknesses.Judgmental: While your powers of perception and observation are often seen as strengths, it may also mean you are quick to prejudge situations and people and to categorize them based upon initial perceptions. The downfall of this is that you potentially sacrifice many opportunities for profitable or enjoyable relationships or experiences simply on the basis of initial outward appearances.
Weaknesses.Impatient: Because you are quick thinkers and doers, you easily become impatient with those who process at a slower pace than you do, who lack your capacity for common sense or street smarts or who tend to be more sensitive or emotional. You feel the emotional concerns of others to be an unnecessary drain on your energy and may resent them. You will also be reluctant to afford weight to intuition or feelings-based arguments.
Weaknesses.Unstructured: People of this type tend to live in a state of urgency and emergency because you do very little advance planning. Though you may be comfortable with this pattern of living, it breeds chaos for everyone around you and can impede your professional and personal relationships. The crux of the issue is that you are often unstructured and undisciplined, exercising poor time management skills and taking on far more than you can handle; often because you have a hard time saying no or you refuse to admit you can’t fit it all in.
Weaknesses.Commitment phobic: You hate to be bored and want life to always be new, stimulating and interesting. The reality, however, is that life is often not interesting or novel and relationships can get a little dull at certain points. You often lack the patience and the drive to stick it out through the low points.

Personality Description.Name: The Go-Getter
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You inherit qualities of being lively and observant both at the same time. You're adept at conflict handling as well.
Personality Description.Description:
You are energetic thrillseekers who are at their best when putting out fires, whether literal or metaphorical. You bring a sense of dynamic energy to their interactions with others and the world around you. You assess situations quickly and move adeptly to respond to immediate problems with practical solutions.
Active and playful, You are often the life of the party and have a good sense of humour. you use their keen powers of observation to assess their audience and adapt quickly to keep interactions exciting. Although You typically appear very social, You are rarely sensitive; You prefer to keep things fast-paced and silly rather than emotional or serious.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You are sociable and outgoing.
2. You draw your energy from the outside world.
3. You talk about your thoughts and feelings and have great communication skills.
4. You are adaptable to every situation and are innovative when problems arise.
5. You are good at multitasking and prefer to work in a team rather than individually.
6. You look for inspiration and ideas from outside sources.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are observant.
2. Your decisions depend on facts and figures.
3. You are rational and realistic.
4. You focus on the present and have a reasonable approach.
5. You use experience and common sense to solve problems.
6. You apply all your senses.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You enjoy technical and scientific fields where logic is important.
2. You look for logical explanations or solutions to everything.
3. You make decisions rationally.
4. You are task-oriented and focused.
5. You are ruled by your head instead of your heart.
6. You are a critical thinker and oriented toward problem-solving.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You are spontaneous with the given tasks.
2. You are a Multitasker.
3. You don't need a plan or clarity to start work.
4. You want to be independent.
5. You dislike structure and are carefree.
6. You tend to be flexible and adaptable.
7. You always keep your options open.

ESTP.Communication Style: You tend to be persuasive, energetic communicators. You quickly observe the realities of the present situation and engage others to take action on practical problems. Many times you speak very freely and can be blunt and impatient in getting your message across. You may not want to wait for someone else to buy in before you can act. Then you may come off as charming, and you are a master at negotiating with others so that you can achieve your goals in the most efficient way possible.
ESTP.Values and Motivations:
You are often natural athletes; you easily navigate their physical environment and are typically highly coordinated. You like to use this physical aptitude in the pursuit of excitement and adventure, and you often enjoy putting their skills to the test in risky or even dangerous activities.
Your focus is action at the moment. You are engaged with their environments and solve practical problems quickly. You are excellent in emergencies when you can apply their logical reasoning to situations where immediate action is necessary. Long-term goals are less interesting to you, who prefers to see tangible results at the moment.
ESTP.Work Place Habits:
At work, you are motivated to solve logical problems at the moment. You have a solid grasp of the concrete realities of a situation and a good sense of the resources at your disposal. Because you understand the facts of the present, you are often able to quickly see a way out of difficult situations.
You rely on past experience to choose the best approach for the situation at hand. you are concrete and hands-on and have a kinetic sense of how things work. Although you may have trouble envisioning abstract ideas, you are flexible in your approach: if something sounds logical, you are usually willing to give it a try.
You often choose careers that take advantage of your athleticism, your mechanical skills, or your ability to negotiate your physical surroundings. You tend to prefer objects to ideas and often like a tangible product. You may have trouble sitting still and often avoid being stuck behind a desk.
You like a job that is a bit unpredictable and offers you some fun and adventure throughout the workday. You want a job which allows you plenty of flexibility to solve problems on the spot, without pressure to follow set procedures or plans.
ESTP.How Others Perceive You:
The first thing you notice about you is likely to be your energy. You’re often chatting, joking, and flirting with friends and strangers alike. You enjoy engaging playfully with others and amusing everyone around you with your irreverent sense of humour. You tend to keep people on your toes, never quite knowing what you will poke fun at next. You are unabashedly gregarious with people, but your interest in individuals may not last long; you are more likely to work a room, having a laugh with everyone than you are to engage in-depth with any one person.
You are comfortable in your physical environment and always looking for some action or activity. You tend to be the most naturally coordinated of all the types and are often found playing sports or engaging in various physical activities, especially ones with an element of danger. You are the stereotypical “adrenaline junkies” and may be found skydiving, motorcycle racing, or enjoying other extreme sports.

You will benefit from taking time for self-reflection and introspection, especially as you age. Throughout your life, you are prone to focus externally, always responding to your environments and the needs of the moment. The constant attention to things outside of yourself can distract you from healthy introspection, causing you to overlook important aspects of your own character and development and leave personal blind spots unaddressed.
Growth Potential.Consider the consequences: You are natural a risk-taker, prone to pursue adventure and risky behaviours. Naturally, this invites the potential for disastrous consequences. Though you are quite confident in your abilities and usually accurate in these personal assessments, you will benefit from greater time spent considering the potential outcomes of your actions and decisions
Growth Potential.Think ahead: You live life so much in the present that you are often incapable of effectively planning for the future. Though you do enjoy flying by the seat of your pants, you will find you benefit from composing at least a loose plan or framework. It isn’t necessary to follow it exactly, but it can help ensure that you move in the direction of meeting your personal and professional goals. You may benefit from help with long-range future planning as well as developing time management skills.
Growth Potential.Follow through: Constant living and responding at the moment can impede follow through and follow up. People of this type must endeavour to balance the acute with the chronic, the emergency situation or deadline with regular life. You should try to look at the whole project or problem and its future impact, not just the urgent piece. For you it is easy, and even comfortable, to jump from urgency to urgency, putting out fires one by one. But jobs need to be finished and wrapped up before hopping to the next task.
Growth Potential.Check the rulebook: You naturally follow your own plans, systems and internal codes. This isn’t because you are intentionally insubordinate, but because you often don’t consider that there may be rules or established protocol that should be considered before plunging ahead. You will avoid unnecessary conflict and tension in the workplace if you can remember to get your plans approved before getting started.

Strengths.Practical insight: Some people are visionaries while others are down-to-earth problem solvers, but you manage to straddle the line between both identities—and you usually succeed masterfully. You are an insightful thinker who sees through situations and people effectively and enjoys developing practical strategies for action.
Strengths.Compassion: As a Feeling type, you might expect you to show compassion—but what sets you apart is that your empathy comes with a sharp intuitive edge. You are quick to recognize worry and unhappiness in friends and loved ones, even when outward signs of distress are not visible to others. You are uniquely capable of detecting unspoken and unacknowledged suffering and are called into action by your instinctive ability to see beneath the surface.
Strengths.Keeping the peace: Mediating disputes is hard work, but you have an astounding ability to help heal the rifts that divide people. You intuitively sense the real suffering that anger can cause if left to fester, and because you are good listeners you are quite effective at helping warring parties find workable solutions that will satisfy the needs of all. And you do it with great energy and determination.
Strengths.Decisiveness: For you, obstacles exist to be overcome and no problem can outmatch the strength and resilience that these types possess deep inside. You follow through on your ideas with conviction and have the willpower and decisiveness necessary to see projects through to the end. You live for the opportunity to solve problems and bring about positive change in the world.

Weaknesses.Overlooking details: No matter how practically-oriented you aspire to be, you have a tendency to get so caught up in theorizing the big picture that you forget to account for some of the precious details that can separate success from failure. Details always matter, and while you may recognize this in principle, in practice you aren’t always as diligent about the small stuff as you should be.
Weaknesses.Intensely private: Despite your loving and sensitive natures, you have a tendency to close yourself off from the world and don’t give people the chance to know you or see the wonderful qualities you possess. Even in your relations with family and trusted friends, you can be enigmatic. When you are feeling frustrated or introspective, you may retreat from social contact without so much as a word of explanation, which can throw others for a loop.
Weaknesses.Conflict averse: You dislike conflict intensely and will usually intervene to stop it, but this is one area where your perspective can get distorted. You often fail to recognize that conflict can actually serve a useful purpose, allowing a good process of give-and-take to be established and giving all parties the opportunity to resolve your problem forever. You would be wise to acknowledge the value of open and honest dialogue, instead of automatically assuming that all squabbling is harmful.
Weaknesses.Sensitive: Once you have made up your mind, you tend to be very confident in your conclusions and may not have much tolerance for those who continue to dissent. When someone challenges your conclusions, you can react very strongly and are especially vulnerable to criticism.

Personality Description.Name: The Mentor
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You're someone who through their kind and dedicated attitude can sense others' emotions even before they know it and provide help to their personal challenges.
Personality Description.Description:
You are creative nurturers with a strong sense of personal integrity and a drive to help others realize their potential. Creative and dedicated, you have a talent for helping others with original solutions to their personal challenges.
The Counselor has a unique ability to intuit others' emotions and motivations, and will often know how someone else is feeling before that person knows it himself. You trust their insights about others and have strong faith in their ability to read people. Although you are sensitive, you are also reserved; you are a private sort and are selective about sharing intimate thoughts and feelings.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You gain energy from reflection and lose energy in social gatherings.
2. You are passionate and not usually aggressive.
3.You are a good listener.
4. You are quiet, reserved and self-sufficient.
5. Gain energy from focusing your mind.
6. You are highly Intellectual.
7. You are a deep thinker.
8. You prefer to work alone and not in groups.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are imaginative and think out of the box.
2. You are innovative, hypothetical and have a futuristic approach towards life.
3. You are highly observant and a deep thinker.
4. You are aware of yourself and your surroundings.
5. You prefer to read between the lines and recognise the connection between random facts
6. Ideas inspire you and you are more likely to focus on the theory than the practice of a project.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You decide with heart and dislike conflict.
2. You are passionate and driven by emotion.
3. You are empathetic and like taking care of others.
4. You pay attention to your moral compass to determine right from wrong and are less interested in the cold, hard facts.
5. You consider the effect of your actions on other people
6. you are concerned with values and what is best for the people involved.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You prefer being organised and live a planned or orderly way of life.
2. You like to be involved in tasks where there is a standard procedure and do not like ambiguity
3. You like to take charge of things and take responsibilities and leading roles.
4. You are self-disciplined and decisive.
5. You don't procrastinate and complete your work on time.

INFJ.Communication Style: You are reserved about communication, and often keep your most treasured ideas and insights private. You are oriented to values and connection and will search for meaning in the information you take in. You think deeply and often need time to process and evaluate before you are ready to share your ideas. You seek validation and will take the time to appreciate others and your ideas. You are often talented at making connections to bring people together and integrate ideas, values, and human potential.
INFJ.Values and Motivations:
You are guided by a deeply considered set of personal values. You are intensely idealistic, and can clearly imagine a happier and more perfect future. You can become discouraged by the harsh realities of the present, but you are typically motivated and persistent in taking positive action nonetheless. You feel an intrinsic drive to do what you can to make the world a better place.
You want a meaningful life and deep connections with other people. You do not tend to share yourself freely but appreciate emotional intimacy with a select, committed few. Although their rich inner life can sometimes make you seem mysterious or private to others, you profoundly value authentic connections with people you trust.
INFJ.Work Place Habits:
At work, you are focused on the task of bettering the human condition. You are dedicated, helpful, and principled workers who can be relied on to envision, plan, and carry out complex projects for humanitarian causes.
Although you are typically driven by lofty ideals, Counselors gain the most satisfaction from your work when you can turn your ideas into reality, creating constructive change for other people.
You are typically organized and prefer work that allows you to complete projects in an orderly manner. You are often independent and tend to prefer a quiet environment that allows you the opportunity to fully develop your own thoughts and ideas.
The ideal work environment for you is harmonious, industrious, and oriented to a humanitarian mission, with co-workers who are similarly committed to positive change. The ideal job for a Counselor allows you to use your creativity in an independent, organized environment to develop and implement a vision that is consistent with your personal values.
INFJ.How Others Perceive You:
You often appear quiet, caring and sensitive, and may be found listening attentively to someone else’s ideas or concerns. You are highly perceptive about people and want to help others achieve understanding. You are not afraid of complex personal problems; in fact, you are quite complex yourself and have a rich inner life that few are privy to. You reflect at length on issues of ethics and feel things deeply. Because Counselors initially appear so gentle and reserved, you may surprise others with your intensity when one of your values is threatened or called into question. Your calm exterior belies the complexity of your inner worlds.
Because you are such complex people, you may be reluctant to engage with others who might not understand or appreciate you and can thus be hard to get to know. Although you want to get along with others and support you in your goals, you are fiercely loyal to your own system of values and will not follow others down a path that does not feel authentic to you. When you sense that your values are not being respected, or when your intuition tells you that someone’s intentions are not pure, you are likely to withdraw.

Growth Potential.Question your intuition: You have outstanding instincts for the most part, but sometimes your intuition betrays you when you are dealing with others. When something is bothering you, you will often withdraw into the safety of your own heads rather than speaking openly about what you are feeling; conversely, you seldom express your feelings of love, affection and appreciation as directly as might be expected given the depth of the emotions you experience. To improve your communication habits, you should go out of your way to share your feelings—both good and bad—with others regardless of how uncomfortable it makes you feel to do so.
You are insightful, instinctive and persuasive. But despite the enormous effort that you invest in developing and selling your concepts and ideas, sometimes dissidents will remain. You sometimes become disenchanted with those who refuse to accept your conclusions, and you will convince yourself that your opponents have hidden agendas and are acting in bad faith. When situations like this arise, you should try to accept that total consensus is impossible and that some will continue to hold contrary viewpoints. In situations like this, both sides should simply agree to disagree and move on.
When tensions are high and arguments are heated, you will do all you can to restore lost cohesion and tranquillity. But your love of harmony and aversion to division is so powerful that you refuse to accept that sometimes the best way to end disputes is to bring them out into the open, where bridges of understanding can be built. On balance, your dislike of conflict is a good thing. But your efforts to play peacemaker might be more successful if you would concentrate on keeping the lines of communication open when disagreements arise instead of always trying to sweep everything under the rug.
Growth Potential.Make connections with extraverts: Because sharing with anyone outside a small trusted circle goes against your instincts, too often talented you choose to keep your gifts wrapped up and hidden even though you have much to contribute. But you would benefit by cultivating friendly relationships with extraverted people whenever possible. Opposites attract, and there is no doubt that being around more naturally open and communicative people can help bring you out of your shells and out into the world where others can benefit from your intellect, empathy and compassion.
Growth Potential.Slow down!: You are productive and effective when you make a concerted effort to focus on one project at a time. But your fertile imaginations frequently undermine your efforts to stay on the straight and narrow, and you will often start new projects based on fresh inspirations before old ones are finished—and, before you know it, you will find yourself buried under an avalanche of work. There is really nothing you can do to moderate the pace of your inspirations, but if you constantly remind yourself to slow down and take things one at a time, you may be able to resist the urge to go off on tangents at least some of the time.

Strengths.Idealism: You care deeply for others and believe it is your duty to make a positive impact on the lives of other people in any way you can. Because of this unbreakable commitment, you are capable of great self-sacrifice, and you won’t compromise your ethical standards for personal benefit. You are firm believers in the unlimited potential of human beings to achieve remarkable things, and you can always be counted on to provide encouragement or material support to those who are attempting to expand your horizons.
Strengths.Integrity: Integrity means everything to you, and that includes intellectual as well as moral integrity. Some people might accuse you of being overly imaginative or of being willing to stretch logic to the breaking point in order to find the deeper meaning you insist must exist, but there is no denying that the deeply reflective nature of you allows you to transcend the boundaries of imagination that so often prevent us from discovering new solutions to old problems.
Strengths.Compromise: As empathic idealists, harmonious relations are like a balm to the soul for you. In family settings or when working in groups, you are highly effective as mediators because you are legitimately interested in the viewpoints of all and will go out of your way to make sure that everyone is given a fair hearing. You are enthusiastic advocates of cooperation and believe that no difficulty is insurmountable when people work together for a common cause.
Strengths.Dedication: It is easy to pay lip service to virtues like compassion, creativity, originality and open-mindedness, but these ideas don’t mean much unless you can be translated into real-world applications. Fortunately, you are masters at doing just that. Passionate and committed to the cause, these personalities have a unique ability to mould and shape your surrounding environment in ways that promote self-improvement and transcendent achievement for all.

Weaknesses.Sensitivity: Your deep compassion, sensitivity and commitment to originality allow you to interface with your interpersonal landscapes in a constructive manner, but these feelings also leave you vulnerable to disillusionment and powerful existential angst. You who venture enthusiastically out into the world can end up retreating into lethargy and depression when you discover your idealism isn’t always shared or respected by others, and your incredible talents can go completely to waste when you become too discouraged to continue.
Weaknesses.Impracticality: While your insistence on standing up for justice and decency is admirable, the intensity of your feelings can occasionally leave you unwilling to make compromises even when doing so might be necessary to get something accomplished. Sticking to your morals is admirable, but in the real world, it may be impossible to accomplish anything unless you can find a way to give and take a little and find practical if imperfect, solutions to problems.
Weaknesses.Selflessness: You have a tendency to neglect or suppress your own needs if you believe it is necessary to keep the peace or make others happy. When a person holds his or her insecurities inside for too long, it can eventually cause a blow-up or an emotional breakdown. Sensitively, you often suffer in silence, and this is a pity because you and your fellow travellers usually have people in their lives who care about you a lot and would be more than happy to help you deal with your heartaches and disappointments.
Weaknesses.Vulnerability: Compassionate to the core, you lead with your hearts rather than your heads and this can sometimes set you up for trouble. Unfortunately, there are users and manipulators out there who are always on the lookout for easy targets, and from the standpoint of these individuals you might as well have flashing neon signs attached to your foreheads that say “exploit me, exploit me!” Trust is a wonderful thing, but not when it makes you gullible.

Personality Description.Name: The Curer
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You like spending time in the ocean of your thoughts and ideas and are concerned about your personal growth and that of the people around you.
Personality Description.Description:
You are an imaginative idealist, guided by your own core values and beliefs. To a Healer, possibilities are paramount; the realism of the moment is only of passing concern. You see the potential for a better future and pursue truth and meaning with their own individual flair.
You are sensitive, caring, and compassionate, and are deeply concerned with the personal growth of yourself and others. Individualistic and nonjudgmental, you believe that each person must find their own path. You enjoy spending time exploring their own ideas and values and are gently encouraging to others to do the same. You are creative and often artistic; you enjoy finding new outlets for self-expression.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You gain energy from reflection and lose energy in social gatherings.
2. You are passionate and not usually aggressive.
3.You are a good listener.
4. You are quiet, reserved and self-sufficient.
5. Gain energy from focusing your mind.
6. You are highly Intellectual.
7. You are a deep thinker.
8. You prefer to work alone and not in groups.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are imaginative and think out of the box.
2. You are innovative, hypothetical and have a futuristic approach towards life.
3. You are highly observant and a deep thinker.
4. You are aware of yourself and your surroundings.
5. You prefer to read between the lines and recognise the connection between random facts
6. Ideas inspire you and you are more likely to focus on the theory than the practice of a project.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You decide with heart and dislike conflict.
2. You are passionate and driven by emotion.
3. You are empathetic and like taking care of others.
4. You pay attention to your moral compass to determine right from wrong and are less interested in the cold, hard facts.
5. You consider the effect of your actions on other people
6. you are concerned with values and what is best for the people involved.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You are spontaneous with the given tasks.
2. You are a Multitasker.
3. You don't need a plan or clarity to start work.
4. You want to be independent.
5. You dislike structure and are carefree.
6. You tend to be flexible and adaptable.
7. You always keep your options open.

INFP.Communication Style: You are a gentle, encouraging communicator who enjoys exploring options and ideas. You envision possibilities for people and are often good at coming up with creative, flexible solutions to problems. You are a typically attentive listener who tries to adapt your communication style to the people you are dealing with. Compassionate and cooperative, you tend to be appreciative of other people and their ideas, although you may be reserved about sharing your own closely held values and ideas with people you do not know well.
INFP.Values and Motivations:
You value authenticity and want to be original and individual in what you do. You are often concerned with a search for meaning and truth within yourself. Following tradition holds little appeal for you; you prefer to do their own exploration of values and ideas and decide for yourself what seems right. You are often offbeat and unconventional, but you feel no desire to conform. You would rather be true to yourself than try to fit in with the crowd.
You are accepting and nonjudgmental in their treatment of others, believing that each person must follow their own path. You are flexible and accommodating, and can often see many points of view. It is important to you to support other people; however, you may react strongly if you feel their own values are being violated. You especially hate being steamrolled by people who insist there is one right way to do things. You want an open, supportive exchange of ideas.
INFP.Work Place Habits:
At work, you are not particularly driven by money or status, preferring work that aligns with your personal values and allows you to help others. You are typically motivated by vision and inspiration and want to engage with projects and causes that feel important to you.
You enjoy the process of creative problem-solving and want to understand complex issues. You appreciate innovation and want to come up with original ideas to improve circumstances for people. An ideal job for a Healer allows you to express your individuality in the way you work and takes advantage of your ability to see unique solutions.
You enjoy working autonomously and having control over how and when to complete a project. You often enjoy participating in teams, although you want to be free to put your own personal stamp on your work. When you do work with other people, it's important to you that you be cooperative, supportive, and flexible, and that you have a similar passion for your ideals.
INFP.How Others Perceive You:
You may initially seem cool, as you reserve your most authentic thoughts and feelings for people you know well. You are reflective and often spiritual, and often interested in having meaningful conversations about values, ethics, people, and personal growth. Typically curious and open-minded, the Healer continually seeks a deeper understanding of yourself and of the people around you. You are passionate about your ideas, but private as well; few people understand the depth of your commitment to your beliefs.
You are sensitive and empathetic, and engage yourself in a lifelong quest for meaning and authenticity. The mundane aspects of life are of less interest to this type, and you are more excited by interesting ideas than by practical facts. You typically accept others without question and may take a special interest in offbeat points of view or alternative lifestyles. You often have a special affection for the arts, especially the avant-garde, as you love experiencing new concepts in self-expression.

Growth Potential.Learn to recognize the difference betwee: People who disagree with you are simply seeing things from a different point of view, but to you, it can feel like you are being backed into a corner. Instead of digging in your heels, you must find a way to detach from the situation so you can comprehend the motivations of your opposition more clearly. If it is only a difference in values and not a lack of you that is responsible for divergent opinions, then you should not expect others to give in to stubbornness any more than you would if the shoe were on the other foot.
Growth Potential.Make sure dreams and fantasies are used: You who look out at the world with idealistic eyes often see grand vistas of beauty and limitless possibility that others are not capable of perceiving. But you sometimes choose to retreat into these fantasies instead of using you to solve real-world problems. Imagination can open the door to better possibilities, and you should never lose sight of its transformative potential.
Growth Potential.Learn to respect the details: No matter how wonderfully inventive a new idea might be, it won’t get anywhere if the logistical details required to put it into practice are ignored or neglected. You may find this aspect of the creative processes a bit boring, but you should challenge yourself to overcome your disinterest and pay attention to all those annoying details anyway.
Growth Potential.Seek out leadership positions: You have strong egalitarian instincts, are natural conciliators, passionately believe in the utility of cooperation, are excellent listeners, and never fail to pay attention when someone has a new idea to share. These admirable qualities double as superb leadership skills, and no one who possesses them should avoid leadership positions simply because you aren’t extraverts. Above all else, leaders must have the respect of those you presume to lead, and you are just as capable of gaining that respect as any other personality type.
Growth Potential.Accept yourself as you are without apolo: Because your standards are so high, you have a hard time forgiving yourself when you fail to meet your own expectations. You may also become indecisive and fall into perfectionism so extreme that it cuts off your flow of creativity and makes it impossible for you to excel and achieve. This dynamic is unfortunate, especially as you would never think of holding others to such impossible standards. For the sake of your mental health and happiness, you must learn to stop comparing yourself to others and recognize that you should prioritize your own happiness.

Strengths.Strategy: You not only see the plan or course of action, but you are also ready and prepared with several back-ups depending on the various circumstances that could possibly arise. With your expansive, future-focused vision for seeing possibilities and recognizing potential, you are also detailed and logical enough to see holes, gaps and inconsistencies.
Strengths.Innovation: Though you may outwardly appear intractable, as a type you are actually quite receptive to and supportive of change and innovation, and this open approach helps to enhance your problem-solving savvy. You believe that most people, processes and systems have the potential to be improved upon and you will seek new and creative ways to try to bring about that change.
Strengths.Determination: You are revered for your bravery and steadfastness in the face of challenge. You are characteristically determined in whatever you are doing, even to the point of relentless, and are not afraid to move in to tackle the really difficult challenges. Rather than feeling daunted or frustrated, this excites and exhilarates you. You trust your judgment and are confident in your ability to solve the problems and overcome the challenges you encounter in your personal or professional lives.
Strengths.Willingness to Learn: You aren’t only looking to change externals and other people. you are also diligently committed to working on yourself. Though you won’t typically dwell long upon your feelings and emotional state, you are fully engaged in the work of self-improvement. You are lifelong learners and will always be looking for ways to increase your knowledge and skills.

Weaknesses.Superiority: Your prowess in the area of intellect, logic and reason is unarguable and definitely among your chief strengths, as is your confidence in your ideas. However, these strengths can turn into weaknesses when you morph into a superiority complex. Unfortunately, among people like you, this is not uncommon. You may be arrogant and condescending, as well as impatient with people who don’t catch on as quickly as you’d like. With those who demonstrate less ability to think logically and rationally, you may be particularly judgmental and intolerant.
Weaknesses.Emotional Distance: You are also known for your low EQ and unwillingness to engage the emotions—your own or others. Preferring to conceptualize the world on a logical, rational basis, you tend to have little patience for emotional concerns. You struggle to pick up on and respond to the emotional cues and needs of others. This can stifle interpersonal relationships, as well as your own growth and development, and may end up keeping others at (at least) arm’s distance.
Weaknesses.Perfectionism: While the meticulousness of you can be a strength, as in all things, too much of a strength can easily become a weakness, and for you, this natural fastidiousness quickly becomes perfectionism, and in this, you can be quite fierce and painstaking. Your standards, in general, are exacting and this critique may be directed not only toward yourself but toward others as well.
Weaknesses.Imbalance: You place a high priority on work and will be quite devoted to his or her professional life. But this comes at a price, namely in time that might be spent on family, other relationships and leisure. It is easy for you to find him or herself with misplaced priorities and, as a result, relational problems. While your drive to succeed professionally can certainly pay off, it can take a toll on the rest of your lives.

Personality Description.Name: The Inventor
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You're someone who is wise enough to solve problems analytically; you like putting your mind to complex problems and enjoy finding solutions to them,
Personality Description.Description:
You are analytical problem-solvers, eager to improve systems and processes with their innovative ideas. You have a talent for seeing possibilities for improvement, whether at work, at home, or in yourself.
Often intellectual, you enjoy logical reasoning and complex problem-solving. You approach life by analyzing the theory behind what you see and are typically focused inward, on their own thoughtful study of the world around you. You are drawn to logical systems and are much less comfortable with the unpredictable nature of other people and their emotions. you are typically independent and selective about their relationships, preferring to associate with people who you find intellectually stimulating.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You gain energy from reflection and lose energy in social gatherings.
2. You are passionate and not usually aggressive.
3.You are a good listener.
4. You are quiet, reserved and self-sufficient.
5. Gain energy from focusing your mind.
6. You are highly Intellectual.
7. You are a deep thinker.
8. You prefer to work alone and not in groups.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are imaginative and think out of the box.
2. You are innovative, hypothetical and have a futuristic approach towards life.
3. You are highly observant and a deep thinker.
4. You are aware of yourself and your surroundings.
5. You prefer to read between the lines and recognise the connection between random facts
6. Ideas inspire you and you are more likely to focus on the theory than the practice of a project.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You enjoy technical and scientific fields where logic is important.
2. You look for logical explanations or solutions to everything.
3. You make decisions rationally.
4. You are task-oriented and focused.
5. You are ruled by your head instead of your heart.
6. You are a critical thinker and oriented toward problem-solving.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You prefer being organised and live a planned or orderly way of life.
2. You like to be involved in tasks where there is a standard procedure and do not like ambiguity
3. You like to take charge of things and take responsibilities and leading roles.
4. You are self-disciplined and decisive.
5. You don't procrastinate and complete your work on time.

INTJ.Communication Style: You are direct and detached in your communication. You often naturally see how something could be done better and usually communicate your criticism in a straightforward, logical manner. You are typically independent and calm; you are not so much concerned about being liked or appreciated as you are with being competent and thoughtful. Your communications are typically well-thought-out, insightful, and strategic. You often plan well into the future and offer big-picture analysis for improving systems.
INTJ.Values and Motivations:
You are perceptive about systems and strategy, and often understand the world as a chessboard to be navigated. You want to understand how systems work, and how events proceed: you often have a unique ability to foresee logical outcomes. You enjoy applying yourself to a project or idea in-depth, and putting in concentrated effort to achieve their goals.
You have a hunger for knowledge and strive to constantly increase their competence; you are often perfectionists with extremely high standards of performance for yourself and others. You tend to have a keen interest in self-improvement and are lifelong learners, always looking to add to their base of information and awareness.
INTJ.Work Place Habits:
At work, you excel at creating and implementing innovative solutions to analytical problems. You naturally see possibilities for improvement within complex systems and are organized and determined in implementing your ideas for change.
You are comfortable with abstraction and theory but gain the most satisfaction from turning your ideas into reality. You often enjoy working independently or with a small team, taking measured, strategic steps to implement change.
You enjoy working with logical systems that you can understand in depth. You enjoy the challenge of comprehending complex ideas and want to understand how you can improve the way things work.
The ideal work environment for you is logical, efficient, structured, and analytical, with colleagues that are competent, intelligent, and productive. The ideal job for a Mastermind allows you to use your analytical skills to problem-solve in a challenging environment and to take responsibility for implementing your ideas to create efficient, innovative systems.
INTJ.How Others Perceive You:
You are typically reserved and serious and seem to spend a lot of time thinking. You are curious about the world around you and often want to know the principle behind what you see. You thoroughly examine the information you receive, and if asked a question, will typically consider it at length before presenting a careful, complex answer. You think critically and clearly, and often have an idea about how to do something more efficiently. You can be blunt in your presentation, and often communicate in terms of the larger strategy, leaving out the details.
Although you aren’t usually warm or particularly gregarious, you tend to have a self-assured manner with people based on your own security in your intelligence. You relate your ideas with confidence, and once you have arrived at a conclusion you fully expect others to see the wisdom in your perceptions. You are typically perfectionists and appreciate an environment of intellectual challenge. You enjoy discussing interesting ideas, and may get yourself into trouble because of your take-no-prisoners attitude: if someone’s beliefs don’t make logical sense, the Mastermind typically has no qualms about pointing that out.

Growth Potential.Go outside of yourself: You are internal processors and accustomed to finding the right answers or the best plans within your own minds. However, such a constant internal focus can mean you may miss important details, as well as the potentially insightful and helpful contributions of others. To improve your own ideas and plans, you should seek input from friends, family and colleagues. Though you have full confidence in his or her own abilities, conferencing with others can breathe new life into a stale approach and can help to uncover blind spots.
Growth Potential.Go inside: You don’t naturally introspect deeply or spend much time considering your emotional state. You focus internally on your many ideas and abstract concepts, but when it comes to looking at yourself and your feelings, you often avoid the activity. Out of touch with your own blind spots and character defects, you can be quick to find fault with others. One solution is to work on cultivating humility and compassion.
Growth Potential.Balance: It is easy for you to become completely consumed with work or some project or plan that he or she has devised. At the moment, this will feel exhilarating for the individual but may have consequences for personal wellbeing and relationships in the long run. Then you should strive for better work-life balance. That also means, as mentioned, taking time to examine his or her emotions and responses. It won’t come naturally but will help interpersonal relationships immensely.
Growth Potential.Pick your battles: It is not necessary to argue every single point, though your thinking nature will compel him or her to do so. This is the default response of your perfectionistic hyper-logical nature. Thus, to better navigate all areas of life, the individual may need to understand that sometimes you have to let the small things go so you can accomplish the big things in the long run.
Growth Potential.If it ain\u2019t broke\u2026and even if: You may need to resist the desire to be continually improving and changing. Your view on potential and possibilities for all products, systems and people, leads you to want to always be fixing and “improving.” What you may not realize is that not all people want to be fixed and not all companies want greater efficiency.

Strengths.Analytically brilliance: Beneath the quiet surface sits an intellectual prowess which you bring to any environment in which you find yourself. You are fast thinkers and highly logical. Others may not know it since much happens inside your own head, yet this type excels in analyzing connections between seemingly random pieces of information and finding flawless explanations to problems that disorient most other personality types.
Strengths.Objective: You are respected for your relentless pursuit of truth, objectivity and understanding. You make this the goal of your lives and channel your energy into rooting out errors and eliminating inconsistencies. You do this not only for your own personal enjoyment but because you see it as your main contribution to the world in whatever field you may find yourself.
Strengths.Imaginative: You think deeply about theory, how to understand and explain difficult concepts, and how systems and products function and might be improved. You naturally see things others don’t because you have imaginations that are actively focused and fixated on future potential and possibility.
Strengths.Enthusiastic: To others, you may come across as private and withdrawn but when a topic piques your interest, you can be very enthusiastic⁠—excited even⁠—about discussing it. This excitement makes you fun to be around. In the right company, you are keen to express your imaginative sense of humour, and enjoy being playful with people who you can trust.

Weaknesses.Uncertainty: Despite your intellectual prowess, you often live in fear of failure, anxious that you will overlook some critical aspect of your theory, idea or invention. This causes you to be self-conscious and to waste time and energy second-guessing yourself.
Weaknesses.Absent-mindedness: You aren’t labelled “absentminded professors” for no reason. At your worst, you tend to be scattered and disorganized. Intellectual and high-minded, you get caught up in your own brains and fail to deal with the low-level tedium of the here and now such as bills or deadlines. You fail may fail to conform to even the basic expectations of daily life in society.
Weaknesses.Condescension: A significant weakness of you is the tendency to be condescending and critical, either of your opponents or those who simply don’t catch on as quickly as you do. Your constant pursuit of truth and objectivity, though admirable, can also provoke brutality and impatience as you drive home your own perspective. This can be especially toxic in relationships in which logic simply does not always reign supreme.
Weaknesses.Insensitivity: You can get into trouble because of your tendency to prioritize the activity taking place in your minds over the needs of others. You comfortably inhabit the realm of your imaginations and this can bring certain problems, not least that you get so caught up in your own theories and abstractions that you forget any kind of emotional consideration. Your focus on ideas and logic, and neglect of personal considerations, can easily offend.

Personality Description.Name: The Designer
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You like working on systems and designs; it is important for you to spend time alone to figure out the mysteries of the universe.
Personality Description.Description:
You are philosophical innovators, fascinated by logical analysis, systems, and design. You are preoccupied with theory and search for the universal law behind everything you see. You want to understand the unifying themes of life, in all their complexity.
You are detached, analytical observers who can seem oblivious to the world around you because you are so deeply absorbed in thought. You spend much of their time focused internally: exploring concepts, making connections, and seeking understanding. To the Architect, life is an ongoing inquiry into the mysteries of the universe.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You gain energy from reflection and lose energy in social gatherings.
2. You are passionate and not usually aggressive.
3.You are a good listener.
4. You are quiet, reserved and self-sufficient.
5. Gain energy from focusing your mind.
6. You are highly Intellectual.
7. You are a deep thinker.
8. You prefer to work alone and not in groups.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are imaginative and think out of the box.
2. You are innovative, hypothetical and have a futuristic approach towards life.
3. You are highly observant and a deep thinker.
4. You are aware of yourself and your surroundings.
5. You prefer to read between the lines and recognise the connection between random facts
6. Ideas inspire you and you are more likely to focus on the theory than the practice of a project.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You enjoy technical and scientific fields where logic is important.
2. You look for logical explanations or solutions to everything.
3. You make decisions rationally.
4. You are task-oriented and focused.
5. You are ruled by your head instead of your heart.
6. You are a critical thinker and oriented toward problem-solving.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You are spontaneous with the given tasks.
2. You are a Multitasker.
3. You don't need a plan or clarity to start work.
4. You want to be independent.
5. You dislike structure and are carefree.
6. You tend to be flexible and adaptable.
7. You always keep your options open.

INTP.Communication Style: You can be insightful communicators when the subject inspires you. Thoughtful and independent, you may not have a great need for conversation, but when discussing complex concepts or innovative ideas you can become quite intense and display a wealth of information and insight. Logical and analytical, you can weigh possibilities endlessly and are great at playing devil’s advocate. You love to pick apart ideas but are not convinced by anything but the most rational of analyses; you can spot a flaw in logic a mile away, and rarely hesitate to point it out.
INTP.Values and Motivations:
You are perceptive about systems and strategy, and often understand the world as a chessboard to be navigated. You want to understand how systems work, and how events proceed: you often have a unique ability to foresee logical outcomes. You enjoy applying yourself to a project or idea in-depth, and putting in concentrated effort to achieve their goals.
You have a hunger for knowledge and strive to constantly increase their competence; you are often perfectionists with extremely high standards of performance for yourself and others. You tend to have a keen interest in self-improvement and are lifelong learners, always looking to add to their base of information and awareness.
INTP.Work Place Habits:
At work, you are motivated to solve complex problems in an original, innovative way. Architects want to analyze systems and ideas thoroughly to create a deep understanding and enjoy designing creative solutions to highly abstract problems.
You rarely have much interest in organizational traditions, preferring to forge your own path to innovation. You hate being limited by bureaucracy and rules, and are often more in tune with the theoretical soundness of your ideas than you are with the practical applications. you typically prefer to focus on creating the idea and to leave the tedious details of implementation to someone else.
You work best independently or with a small team of colleagues that you perceive as smart, competent, and logical. You quickly tire of colleagues who are aggressive or overbearing and can be dismissive of people who aren't as clever as yourself.
An ideal organization for you is flexible and non-traditional and values ingenuity over conformity. An ideal job for you allows you to address complex theoretical or technical problems with creative, novel solutions.
INTP.How Others Perceive You:
You are often thoroughly engaged in your own thoughts and usually appear to others to be offbeat and unconventional. Your mind is a most active place, and your inward orientation can mean that you neglect superficial things like home décor or appropriate clothing. You don’t tend to bother with small talk but can become downright passionate when talking about science, mathematics, computers, or the larger theoretical problems of the universe. Reality is often of only passing interest to the Architect, as you are more interested in the theory behind it all.
You are typically precise in your speech, and communicate complex ideas with carefully chosen words. You insist on intellectual rigour in even the most casual of conversations, and will readily point out inconsistencies of thought or reasoning. Social niceties may fall by the wayside for you who is more interested in analyzing logic, and you may offend others by submitting your dearly held values and beliefs to logical scrutiny.

Growth Potential.Develop emotional intelligence: Though you can make very good friends and partners, you are not overly warm or attentive to the feelings and emotional cues of others. While emotional receptiveness and responsiveness will not come naturally to people of this type, focusing on key behaviours that help other people to feel heard and cared for will expand your ability to relate and connect.
Growth Potential.Harness the power of relationships: Though you are naturally solitary, you are not at your best when you neglect key relationships. You can easily become isolated, especially if you are working on a difficult problem. While you may be indifferent to how many friends or personal relationships you have, you who can learn to purposely cultivate your social and professional connections will be more successful—and happier in the end.
Growth Potential.Bring others in: You can easily find yourself rutted or caught in your own blind spots and, given the amount of time you spend in solitude, you may not regularly enjoy the input of others that can help to put you back on course. By bringing other people into your inner worlds, you not only serve your relationships, but you also get important feedback that can help you to clarify your high-level ideas and make them understandable and useful to a wider audience.
Growth Potential.Think practically: This may be a challenge because you are not characteristically utilitarian or particularly pragmatic. This doesn’t mean you don’t value efficiency, but that you believe in the value of thinking and experimenting for its own sake, even if there is no practical value or outcome attached to it. While we need people who are committed to taking on dream projects and experiments simply because they’re good things to do, employers may be less sympathetic. You should step back and consider your projects from a practical stance. Will this idea actually work? Does it matter? Is this a product people would actually use? Does it have practical value?
Growth Potential.Become more charitable: You will always be relentless about what is right, true and logical, but can become more charitable with time and effort. This will also involve working to understand and take into account the emotional concerns of others and seeking to develop empathy and compassion. You can start by trying to look at and understand your own emotions.

Strengths.Practical: With a keen memory, an eagle’s eye for observation and an absolute determination to account for every detail, you are practical workers par excellence. When focused on a mission, you possess a Sherlock Holmes-like disposition to solve practical problems, built on an in-depth understanding of concrete facts.
Strengths.Hardworking: Intense and serious when a task needs to be completed, you are super-competent a go-getter who brings a hard-nosed approach to your work that can sometimes seem excessive to others. But it’s important to remember that you care deeply about people. When you put her game face on it is a sign that she believes what she is doing will improve people’s lives and is worth taking seriously.
Strengths.Supportive: You are the consummate helpers; happy to share your time and energy with anyone who needs it and taking an empathetic approach to problems and goals. As parents, partners, friends, students, workers, entrepreneurs, neighbours, community members, public servants and citizens, you always strive for excellence, and it is the inclusivity and comprehensiveness of your vision that forms your identity and gives you your unique ability to brighten every corner of the worlds you inhabit.
Strengths.True to your word: By now we are all familiar with the values that you hold dear: honour, integrity, responsibility, loyalty and commitment. This is all well and good, but to you, it is far more important to walk the walk than talk the talk, and this is where you shine like the brightest stars. In business and personal relations, you are straight shooters who say what you mean and mean what you say. Your word is as good as gold.

Weaknesses.Resistant to change: You regard to custom and tradition with the utmost respect and can become anxious with a world you see changing too fast and people who refuse to follow established standards. You in full "tut-tut/tsk-tsk" mode may convince yourself that moral decay and a loss of respect for personal responsibility are destroying our society from the inside out, and you can become so immersed in pessimism that you will start seeing signs of degeneration and devolution everywhere you look. Diversity of thought and opinion is truly the spices of life, but you can become so enamoured with orthodoxy that you forget this essential fact of existence.
Weaknesses.Too altruistic: Loyalty is an admirable character trait to be sure, but it is a two-way street, and if the people we choose to trust prove to be dishonest or unreliable we must be prepared to walk away. Yet you struggle with letting go, and have a tendency to stay in it to the bitter end, convinced that this is the only honourable thing to do.
Weaknesses.Take things personally: You are very private people, bordering on the shy, and this does not always mesh well with more open, unpredictable personality types. The social complexity of the environments you inhabit can overwhelm you and leave you feeling like square pegs in a universe of round holes. You have trouble dealing with conflict and a tendency to take even minor criticism personally. Combined with your stubborn streak, this can leave you feeling vulnerable and put upon, and you may resort to judgmental criticism yourself as a defence mechanism.
Weaknesses.Overload yourself: You are known for your terrific work ethic, but over time this positive trait can transmute into workaholism and leave you so overloaded that she loses sight of everything else. Workaholic you can be driven to distraction by your perfectionist tendencies, and even on those rare occasions when you manage to tear yourself away from the office and return home for a while, you will continue to obsess over your latest project or assignment, leaving you too distracted and preoccupied to enjoy your free time.

Personality Description.Name: The Guardian
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You’re an all time contributor to society who is compassionate about saving others from any kind of jeopardy.
Personality Description.Description:
You are industrious caretakers, loyal to traditions and organizations. You are practical, compassionate, and caring, and are motivated to provide for others and protect them from the perils of life.
You are conventional and grounded, and enjoy contributing to established structures of society. You are steady and committed workers with a deep sense of responsibility to others. You focus on fulfilling their duties, particularly when you are taking care of the needs of other people. You want others to know that you are reliable and can be trusted to do what is expected of you. You are conscientious and methodical, and persist until the job is done.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You gain energy from reflection and lose energy in social gatherings.
2. You are passionate and not usually aggressive.
3.You are a good listener.
4. You are quiet, reserved and self-sufficient.
5. Gain energy from focusing your mind.
6. You are highly Intellectual.
7. You are a deep thinker.
8. You prefer to work alone and not in groups.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are observant.
2. Your decisions depend on facts and figures.
3. You are rational and realistic.
4. You focus on the present and have a reasonable approach.
5. You use experience and common sense to solve problems.
6. You apply all your senses.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You decide with heart and dislike conflict.
2. You are passionate and driven by emotion.
3. You are empathetic and like taking care of others.
4. You pay attention to your moral compass to determine right from wrong and are less interested in the cold, hard facts.
5. You consider the effect of your actions on other people
6. you are concerned with values and what is best for the people involved.
How do you prefer to plan the work ?: 1. You prefer being organised and live a planned or orderly way of life.
2. You like to be involved in tasks where there is a standard procedure and do not like ambiguity
3. You like to take charge of things and take responsibilities and leading roles.
4. You are self-disciplined and decisive.
5. You don't procrastinate and complete your work on time.

ISFJ.Communication Style: You take a supportive role in communication, listening to tune into the needs of others. You tend to be sensitive and want to collaborate to support everyone involved. You rarely demand the floor but are often quietly taking in detailed information from the world around you. You contribute information when you see a practical use for it or when you see that it could be helpful. You are loyal to what you see first-hand, and will often share perspectives based on personal experience.
ISFJ.Values and Motivations:
You are driven by their personal values and are conscientious in their behaviour. You typically want to work hard, get along with others, and make sure you do what is expected of you.
You value relationships highly and strive to cooperate and maintain harmony with others. You want stability and longevity in their relationships and tend to maintain a deep devotion to family. You feel most connected with people you know you can rely upon over the long term.
You appreciate tradition and like knowing how things were done in the past. You are loyal to established methods and values and want to observe the proper, accepted way of doing things. You place great importance on fitting in with established institutions and contributing what you can to maintain strong, stable social structures. In groups, you often take on the role of historian, ensuring that new members respect and value the established customs.
ISFJ.Work Place Habits:
At work, you are motivated by the desire to help others in a practical, organized way. You are driven by your core of personal values, which often include upholding tradition, taking care of others, and working hard.
You enjoy work that requires careful attention to detail and adherence to established procedures and like to be efficient and structured in your completion of tasks. You prefer an explicit authority structure and clear expectations.
You usually prefer to work behind the scenes, and like to receive recognition in a low-key way without being required to present your work publicly. You want to feel that you have fulfilled your duties, but do not want to be thrust into the spotlight.
An ideal job for you involves well-defined work tasks that achieve a concrete or observable result and does not require a lot of multi-tasking. An ideal work environment for you is orderly, provides plenty of privacy, and includes colleagues who share your values.
ISFJ.How Others Perceive You:
You are characteristically humble and unassuming, and rarely call attention to yourself. You can often be found offering assistance to others in a modest, understated way. you are loyal and hardworking and often commit yourself to tasks and projects with the aim of being helpful to your families, friends, and communities. You are typically involved in social groups, but do not want the spotlight: You are more likely to be found behind the scenes, working diligently to fulfil your role.
You are oriented to relationships, but can be reserved with new people. You rarely disclose personal information quickly. You tend to be focused and aware of your surroundings and relate details from your own personal experience. You often converse in terms of what has happened to you and what you have seen first-hand. You are compassionate listeners, and typically remember details about people. You often enjoy hearing the facts about others in the process of making a connection.

Growth Potential.Seek out contact with alien life forms: You have a tendency to ensnare yourself in your own worldviews and spend far too much time living inside your own heads. As such, you desperately need social contact with people who have different mindsets and ideological inclinations; this type of constructive social interaction can help you become more comfortable with diversity and accepting of social change, and it can prevent you from developing that stern schoolmaster’s countenance that others find so reactionary and off-putting.
Growth Potential.Speak even when you haven\u2019t been sp: In your dealings with other people you sometimes operate as if your life's purpose is to keep the peace and make everyone happy—everyone except yourself, that is. This habit of suppressing emotions and deferring to the needs of others may seem noble, but in reality, it can trap you in non-productive relationships that won’t make you happy. Speak up for yourself to reach your full potential as a human being.
Growth Potential.Step outside your comfort zone: This is good advice for everybody, but particularly for you who tend to get stuck in your routines to the point where you don’t have any time left over for fun and adventure. Take care to connect with your spontaneous, creative side, trying something new every now and then to ensure that your reverence for the tried-and-true does not calcify into rigidity.
Growth Potential.Lighten up!: While your serious and sober attitude may be well-intentioned, a little humour and irreverence from time to time never hurt anyone—you don’t want to be the person who sucks the life out of a room. When you are on the job, in particular, you should realize that fun, laughter and the occasional unplanned coffee break can help relieve stress and build camaraderie, which will only help to boost workplace efficiency in the long run.
Growth Potential.Don\u2019t worry, be happy: Caution in the face of the unknown is your standard operating procedure, and it can be paralyzing—stopping personal growth in its tracks. It makes sense to worry in some instances but the incessant worry is like a Death Star to happiness. Let go of the perfectionism every now and then and live a little. It’s only when you relax your strict standards that true happiness will come.

Strengths.Observant: You are super-observant and seldom overlook any details. However, what makes you so gifted as problem-solvers is that you know how to synthesize what you sense and experience into a coherent whole. You are experts at finding patterns and connections, and this ability allows you to see possibilities for change and improvement that others miss. Best of all, the advice you give and the solutions you recommend are always practical, sensible and capable of making any situation better in the present moment.
Strengths.Bold and spontaneous: Craving fun and excitement as you do, you know that life is short and that we must seize the moment before it passes us by. You live extremely active lives, boldly pursuing many hobbies and undertaking many exciting projects. You’re also spontaneous enough to leap at chances for new experiences whenever you might appear.
Strengths.Principled: You will not sacrifice your principles for anything, and you have little tolerance for cheaters, liars or hypocrites. Because you are so respectful and find conflict distasteful, you will not confront people who disappoint you, but you will disassociate yourself from those individuals as soon as you possibly can.
Strengths.Individual: Some people spend your whole lives conforming to established standards and traditions. But you prefer to dance to the beat of your own drummers, relying on your own instincts to reveal what is right, good and true. You don’t do this as a way to gain attention or stand out from the crowd. You simply believe that human nature is complex and varied and that everyone’s path should be unique.

Weaknesses.Too sensitive: Kind and considerate you are so determined to keep the peace that you frequently suppress your unpleasant emotions or ignore your own needs. Putting people first is great, but you too often forget to include yourself among that privileged group. Unfortunately, you are very sensitive and can have your feelings hurt at the drop of a hat, so your habit of deferring to the interests of others to avoid conflict tends to put you in uncomfortable positions time after time.
You are innovative, flexible and adaptable. But there is a fine line between flexibility and indecisiveness, and sometimes you are so open-minded that you are unable to make firm and final decisions. Too often, you sway back and forth like willows in the wind, changing your minds repeatedly in response to every persuasive argument you hear.
Weaknesses.Easily bored: You are doers who learn through direct experience and imitation. If the instruction you receive seems too abstract or theoretical, you view it with suspicion, believing this style of teaching to be boring or irrelevant. But this preference can adversely affect your performance as students. Effective learning requires focus and commitment, and you at times are not as dedicated as you should be. This can limit your ability to absorb new and useful knowledge.
Weaknesses.Lack of future planning: You don’t always perceive the full consequences of your actions, or understand how the present inevitably shapes the future. Those who refuse to look beyond the immediate horizon may be unprepared for unpleasant happenings or overwhelmed by new duties and responsibilities—such as those that accompany the arrival of a child, for example. As a result, you may struggle with financial affairs, be ambushed by emergencies or fail to notice the way unresolved conflicts can poison relationships over the long term.

Personality Description.Name: The Symphonist
Personality Description.Two Line Description: You're someone who enjoys serenity in your surroundings and could be a slightly introverted being.
Personality Description.Description:
You are gentle caretakers who live in the present moment and enjoy their surroundings with cheerful, low-key enthusiasm. You are flexible and spontaneous and like to go with the flow to enjoy what life has to offer. You are quiet and unassuming and may be hard to get to know. However, to those who know you well, you are warm and friendly, eager to share in life's many experiences.
You have a strong aesthetic sense and seek out beauty in their surroundings. You are attuned to sensory experience, and often have a natural talent for the arts. You especially excel at manipulating objects and may wield creative tools like paintbrushes and sculptor's knives with great mastery.
Where do you prefer to focus your energy: 1. You gain energy from reflection and lose energy in social gatherings.
2. You are passionate and not usually aggressive.
3.You are a good listener.
4. You are quiet, reserved and self-sufficient.
5. Gain energy from focusing your mind.
6. You are highly Intellectual.
7. You are a deep thinker.
8. You prefer to work alone and not in groups.
How do you grasp and process the informa: 1. You are observant.
2. Your decisions depend on facts and figures.
3. You are rational and realistic.
4. You focus on the present and have a reasonable approach.
5. You use experience and common sense to solve problems.
6. You apply all your senses.
How do you make the decisions?: 1. You decide with heart and dislike conflict.
2. You are passionate and driven by emotion.
3. You are empathetic and like taking care of others.
